title: Office Work Isn't a Burden
content:
Sunday thoughts:

Working from the office should not be seen as a burden or an obligation.

Being at the office from Tuesday to Thursday is the guidance for the CFO
world and since large part of our business at Pune is that, irrespective
of your functional group that would me be my recommendation. If you are
part of Mike's world it is not a choice to not come on Tuesday-Thursday.

If you schedule personal appointments unless inflexible or urgent, set
them up for Monday or Friday. As required also take the day(s) off.

Many of us come even on Mondays and Fridays, so while I don't expect
anyone to be here 5 days a week (it may become a mandate at some point)
if you cannot make it on Tuesday, Wednesday or Thursday then find
another proxy day.

I have seen that many in the younger generations are forgetting that we
went to schools and colleges, we attended for 5 days and in many cases
5.5 days. Sometimes we attended vivas and special lectures even on a
Sunday. All of a sudden there is an entitled mindset. Not sure why???

If any of you owned your business you would run it exactly like this. So
help me run this setup as if we all owned this place together. Share
these thoughts (voice over recommended) with your teams as required.

title: Asking Great Questions Gets Great Answers
content:
Sunday thoughts:

What a great question to ask the CEO of Snowflake and even a greater
response. Before you see that

Here is my take: I want to see a Snowvation use case that ingests large
data set (event logs, authentication/authorization logs or telemetry
data sets) with SNOWPIPE, transform as required, modeled as UNISTORE
capable, with an ML model built to train the data set and a possible
app/UI to leverage SNOWPARK/STREAMLIT and respond to below thoughts from
Mark Ronald. The app should build conversational AI interpretations of
the logs to respond to user queries. Thoughts/Takers??

Mark Ronald

Okay. As a follow-up, Frank, I wanted to ask you on the topic of
generative AI and large language models. Can you frame up the
opportunity there for Snowflake because I would think with the Unistore,
you could probably handle all these chat logs. You could be training
some of these models on very large data sets. I would think that
Snowpipe\'s can pull in social media feeds and kind of help to improve
those models. You see any customer activity around that vector or any
tailwinds you think that could be developing in time?

Frank Slootman

Well, it\'s still early in the cycle. Obviously, like everybody else,
we\'re all over it in terms of evaluating where these technologies can
make a difference. I mean the things that we sort of hone in on short
term, is called completion code optimizations, things that are very,
very clear business returns.

One of the challenges with these new technologies that people come up
with a lot of interesting questions, but without a solid business model
that\'s not going to take off. So we take a very pragmatic view. We do
anticipate that Snowflake data will be a very, very big driver of large
language model in conjunction with many, many other data sources. So we
think that the gravity around data will drive a lot of this action
activity to our platform.

Concluding with an Oxymoron: Your job will not become obsolete if you
are thinking about how your skills will become obsolete in 5 years from
now.

title: Agree to Disagree Stay Aligned

relevance.Communication: Discusses open dialogs and resolving disagreements constructively

content:
**Power of Congruency:** In the geometry of human intelligence, we
touched based on adjacency for skills, products and productivity
acceleration. Similarly, for organizations to prosper, **congruence** at
all levels is important. There will often be disagreements with managers
and your peers. You need to know what the disagreement is about and need
to have a mindset to 'agree to disagree' and be on the same page. This
avoids bureaucracy and tangential movements, keeping all of us in the
same direction. Yet again, having honest introspections and open dialogs
is the key, and to know that the key is in your hands and not with
someone else.

**RLHF & AGI** : AI models continuously improve their capabilities from
Reinforced Learning with Human Feedback (RLHF), this is how they become
more human-like. In a nutshell, AI models continue to improve their
understanding with how you understand or not from the responses. Future
of Artificial Intelligence will lead us to Artificial General
Intelligence (AGI), a system that will possess human-like cognitive
abilities across a wide range of tasks. This is how GPTs will eventually
evolve to be AGI based.

**10x thinking:** Technology and technologists are perceived to become
irrelevant with these AI innovations. We have hired the best of the best
talent and are always chasing ambitious goals to deliver for our
initiatives. If we think that AI will replace technologists then you are
not a good one to begin with. ChatGPT and likes can make you productive
by 10x.

1x input =\> GPT =\> 10x output; the only thing in question is your "x".

relevance.Colleagues: Redefining team membership to include your manager

content:
Who is in your team? Often, when we narrate about the members of our team we first think of the people who we depend on, ones who make us proud and the ones that usually follow our lead. Simple and easy enough. Not quite.

As you would think of the people that work for you, your manager might think of you as a part of her/his team similarly. So of course, yet another thought to reflect on your manager as a member of your team - I owe it to this person.

One of the 16 things in my sweet-16 list of leadership qualities, peer relationships play an important role. Think about this - the most difficult group to work alongside is going to be peers, whether you are a leader or not, as we implicitly compete with them. Your ability to work with your peers will make your leader's job much easier. It will allow him/her to work on bigger opportunities. Peer relationship will accelerate the trust within the organization and often against our discomfort this becomes a key skill to develop. Imagine the impact on our productivity and culture, if your leader has to spend a lot of time resolving disputes within the team.

On the macro front, many countries including BRICS are evaluating to trade in non-US dollar currencies for their commerce. This will potentially change how the US dollar is used as an intermediary. Besides this there is some more attention largely given to non-regulated currency in the form of crypto, given that the regulated fiat currencies are going through unpredictable movements. Also as a result, gold prices have appreciated 15-20% in the last 6 months.

Lastly, being curious is so important. I had met a young man in Goa a few years ago and I saw his name on his uniform, it read 'Arlindo'. I asked him what it meant - he said no idea. I met another young girl similarly last week during the customer show case in Mumbai. I asked what 'Eralinda' meant and she had no idea. I had looked both of them up, 'Arlindo' is a name of Portuguese origin and meant an Eagle. 'Eralinda' means spirited, of Hebrew origin. She told me that I made her day by talking about it.

title: Customer Showcases Teach You Practice Matters

relevance.Communication: Customer communication requires practice and preparation
relevance.Customer: Emphasizes importance of practice in customer showcases

content:
Last week was full of enriching experiences for me as I had the opportunity to host customer showcases at TCS, the Mahindra Group, and Bajaj Allianz, as well as host the all-hands meeting and work on my professional pitch. Speaking with customers certainly requires a lot of practice, and I learned a lot from these experiences. Here are some key takeaways from the week.

One thing that struck me was how much potential there is in the AI industry right now. It reminded me of the early days of social media and content creation, where early adopters were able to create multi-million dollar businesses by being among the first to capitalize on new platforms.

Now, with AI and chatbots like ChatGPT, there is a new gold rush to capitalize on this technology. But there's also another technology that is still in development that could change the game in a big way: superconductors.

Superconductors are materials that allow objects to levitate and allow for incredibly efficient energy transfer. For example, a train could be run with just one push if it was built with superconductors, and a microprocessor based on superconductors would use only 1% of the energy compared to a semiconductor-based chip. Similarly, superconductor-based batteries would lose only 5% of their energy compared to regular chemical composition-based batteries.

Although much of the research around superconductors is currently being done at universities, if a material could be developed that can super-conduct electricity at room temperature, it would revolutionize the AI industry. Building mag-lev trains, superconductor-based chips, efficient energy transmission, and batteries would be a piece of cake.

So, it's important to remain invested, at least intellectually, in the progressive development of energy-efficient microprocessors, content/data publishing and hosting platforms (like our Data Cloud), and core AI platform companies. Be ready to welcome the AI age and make it snow, even then.

title: Free Money Creates Banking Crises Later

opportunity to host customer showcases at TCS, the Mahindra Group, and
Bajaj Allianz, as well as host the all-hands meeting and work on my
professional pitch. Speaking with customers certainly requires a lot of
practice, and I learned a lot from these experiences. Here are some key

dollar businesses by being among the first to capitalize on new

is still in development that could change the game in a big way:
superconductors.

content/data publishing and hosting platforms (like our Data Cloud), and

2 April, 2023

**Who is in your team?** Often, when we narrate about the members of our
team we first think of the people who we depend on, ones who make us
proud and the ones that usually follow our lead. Simple and easy enough.
Not quite.

As you would think of the people that work for you, your manager might
think of you as a part of her/his team similarly. So of course, yet
another thought to reflect on your manager as a member of your team - I
owe it to this person.

One of the 16 things in my sweet-16 list of leadership qualities, peer
relationships play an important role. Think about this - the most
difficult group to work alongside is going to be peers, whether you are
a leader or not, as we implicitly compete with them. Your ability to
work with your peers will make your leader's job much easier. It will

accelerate the trust within the organization and often against our
discomfort this becomes a key skill to develop. Imagine the impact on
our productivity and culture, if your leader has to spend a lot of time
resolving disputes within the team.

On the **macro** front, many countries including BRICS are evaluating to
trade in non-US dollar currencies for their commerce. This will
potentially change how the US dollar is used as an intermediary. Besides
this there is some more attention largely given to non-regulated
currency in the form of crypto, given that the regulated fiat currencies
are going through unpredictable movements. Also as a result, gold prices
have appreciated 15-20% in the last 6 months.

Lastly, being **curious** is so important. I had met a young man in Goa
a few years ago and I saw his name on his uniform, it read 'Arlindo'. I
asked him what it meant - he said no idea. I met another young girl
similarly last week during the customer show case in Mumbai. I asked

'Arlindo' is a name of Portuguese origin and meant an Eagle. 'Eralinda'
means spirited, of Hebrew origin. She told me that I made her day by
talking about it.

9 April, 2023

By now, most of you have familiarized yourself with chatGPT, if not used
extensively. As we peel this onion, there is a divided front in the tech
world to decide if we temporarily hold evolution/use of AI tools or we
continue with the acceleration. There are concerns primarily regarding
whether we should build a framework right now for regulated and safe use
of AI tools or react after much of the damage is done. Also, imagine in
the world of miscreants, if chatGPT starts interacting with another AI
tool endlessly to talk without human intervention. What would that look
like?

A leadership thought on **Power of Adjacency:** Earlier last week, a
young woman came to me for professional counseling. She had a dilemma of
whether to inherit and run a very successful family business or create a
new business from scratch. Her reservation was against how certain
businesses especially in male dominant cultures do not appreciate the
other gender.

I asked her to speak with her father openly and explain to him about her
reservations. I advised that they refine the business model to build a
sophisticated facade that takes away the traditional male dominant
reservations and to bring a net neutral new-age corporate view to the
traditional business that is an acceptable **adjacent** working model.
It will take a few years however not impossible to create.

How does this matter to us? Firstly, if you imagine the landscape of our
platform, as we moved from data warehouse on the cloud to the cloud data
platform and then to the de facto data cloud, we came through evolution

adjacent capabilities to make them part of our platform. Remember, how
Frank mentioned in his note about us being a platform, not a tool. All
this happens with incorporating many new adjacent capabilities.

Leadership works similarly. We struggle from having done the same thing
for many years. An easy transition would be for us to build skills in
adjacency. Being a data engineer you can be a data analyst, BSA to a PM,
QA analyst to a data analyst or even a BSA. This transition is much
easier through job rotations in adjacent teams within the organization
as you reduce the points of complexity from cultural familiarity. My
personal career trajectory has followed the trait for many years and
will continue to be so.

**Blockchain and Crypto:** I haven't touched this topic in a while. If
there is one thing blockchain does well, it preserves evidence
perfectly. Tracking transactions in fiat currencies is hard -
transactions and fraud tracking becomes an uphill task as money moves

Though not yet largely regulated, crypto has amazing ledger tracking

**AutoGPT**: Last time, I had mentioned GPT tools talking to each other.

next task, automatically. AutoGPT was trying to create an app for a
developer, it recognized that the developer did not have Node (Tool kit

-   It googled how to install Node on its own

-   Found a stack overflow article with link

-   Downloaded and Extracted for auto-install

-   Spawned a server, all of this on its own

This will very soon graduate AI tools from being a coding co-pilot, to a
Personal Digital Assistant, managing programs/projects and auto
assignment of tasks, follow-ups and many more use cases for auto-CRM,
planning a holiday and a lot more.

**Uphill climb in the Mid-management:** Few thoughts for the leaders,
especially for mid-management. In this machine led economy, many
organizations have changed structures to flatten leadership layers. It
is imperative that in addition to leading super productive
organizations, you as a leader are constantly demonstrating the ability
to make an impact and have strong narratives of what you deliver. On a
side note, don't take a stand on internal or external affiliation that
sound like politics.

Speed, agility and readily available **masterstrokes** are important.
This was nicely demonstrated by introducing ML and ChatGPT as an
efficiency mechanism in our QA architecture last week. Kudos to [[Nirmal
Raisoni]{.underline}](mailto:nirmal.raisoni@snowflake.com)- a topic for
our staff next week. Of course, Service Mesh, Templatized Reporting
(Data Analytics) and Predictive Intelligence in ServiceNow are also very
exciting topics. So what is your **Masterstroke** - is it ready in your
backpocket and how soon before you share it?

content:
Earlier in April this year, I started sharing my learnings with my direct leadership team and coined it as 'Sunday Thoughts'. I am expanding the outreach after receiving some input to share with the larger audience.

Where is AI?

A lot has transpired with Generative AI this year, which has been a key topic of interest for me along with macroeconomics, geopolitics and our beloved Data Cloud. AI coin has two sides like anything else: one that will probably reshape and displace jobs/industries and another side that will stand up to beat the next pandemic, climate crisis, energy challenges and asteroids. We need to embrace AI through constant education and awareness.

More than a decade ago, I was introduced to terms like SDDC (Software Defined Data Center) and SD-WAN (Software Defined Wide Area Network). Virtual Machines enabled Software Defined Data Centers where these logical machines were connected over Software Defined Network. We are seeing a lot more activities in Software and Hardware driven AI capabilities.

Recently, there were major announcements about the NVIDIA Omniverseâ„¢ Avatar Cloud Engine (ACE). Let's examine this a bit more by reviewing a few terms.

Universe: All of the space along with time context represent our universe (Uni for one)

Multiverse: Multiple universes exist in a multiverse (parallel), beyond our observable universe (Multi for many)

Omniverse: Collection of every single universe, including multiverses represent Omniverse (Omni for All inclusive)

Metaverse: This is an immersive virtual world which facilitated by Virtual Reality (hence Meta)

Now imagine, NVIDIA Omniverse Avatar Cloud Engine where Metaverse meets AI. This as I understand is a single, shared, immersive, persistent, 3D virtual space where humans experience life in ways they could not in the physical world. Imagine physical factories for Chips (ICs), Batteries, Electric Vehicles and others are virtualized/digitalized in an immersive platform, they are now redesigned and improved in the NVIDIA Omniverse ACE before the actual physical factories are changed. I am personally excited to hear more about this at our Summit where we will have Frank Slootman speak with Jensen Huang, President of NVIDIA. Hopefully there is further intersection of our Data Cloud in this Metaverse at some point.

Another topic on the leadership styles to review is the 'HIPPO Effect'. The HIPPO effect describes a cognitive bias according to which the opinion of the highest paid person receives more attention. We all deal with this situation many times and our leadership posture of going (being) direct will make an oxymoron out of this context. I encourage you all to not build a bigger HIPPO out of the leaders that you interact with. This would mean that you need to find the right place and right time to provide thoughts and inputs for you to be heard. Don't be a yes (wo)man and figure out a way to share your perspectives and don't use the watercooler to share your thoughts, go to the source.

Have you seen a Hippo? Are you one?

relevance.Competition: Understanding monopoly power through the lens of imperfect substitutes

content:
Monopoly is a situation where there are no close substitute offerings for a product or a service. You saw that with Microsoft Windows, Google Search, perhaps even a local electricity company or a national railway agency.

Differentiating and Competing with Threads

Comparatively, you have Facebook, YouTube, Whatsapp, Instagram, TikTok, SnapChat, Pinterest, Reddit, Linked, Twitter and many others representing a sea of offerings as competitive social/professional media for the individuals. To add to this wonderland, Meta recently announced its Threads platform and you would wonder why.

-   Twitter is working to limit number of views of its platforms in order to avoid harvesting of its data sets so it turns out to be a an opportunity for a new player

-   At the same time, to be a player in the LLM game, you need a platform rich of textual (language) data which neither Facebook nor Instagram is

-   Using Twitter as it competes with traditional media and enables citizen journalism, Threads will become another player

-   Threads can remain more agnostic of fake news compared to the other social media platforms

Of course, there is a wave of subscribers that jumped on to meet this new kid on the block. Whether it offers a new differential value or not is another question that will only be answered with time.

Differentiating and Competing with ChatGPT

Similarly, ChatGPT had a reduced number of users and usage in the recent past. Has the excitement for the new kid on the block faded, are there more competitive players and there isn't much of a differential offering or is it that given the summer holidays students who used OpenAI/ChatGPT, reduced the usage. ChatGPT has just about 4 Million paying subscribers and of these only 500,000 users use non-prompt based interface to invoke API calls in OpenAI.

Mind you, a lot of advances in physical sciences, healthcare (creation of new drugs), and making software development autonomous will be some of the significant transformations with API based usage of the LLMs to provide a differential value and offering. As such the number of 'consumer' use cases will reduce while increasing the consumption in the 'enterprise' businesses, which is a big success criteria for a software business.

Differentiating and Competing with Self

This raises a question as an individual: is there competition that I deal with - what is my resilience to the perceived competition. What is my differential offering? Be like a racehorse, put the blinders on to not look sideways and aim for your goal. Play to win like a Golf player, make your next shot better than the previous one and create a better version of you.

content:
Technology Macros: Then, Now and the Future

About a decade ago, the combined Market Capitalization of Facebook (~$100B), Apple (~$425B), Amazon ($140B), Netflix (~$20B), Microsoft ($280B) and Google (~$300B) was valued at ~$1.2 Trillion.

Today Meta (~$800), Apple (~$2.86T), Amazon (~$1.43T), Netflix (~$191B ), Microsoft (~$2.44T) and Google (~$1.62T) amass Market Capitalization in the order of ~$9.3 Trillion.

Comparatively, in the last 10 years, the United States' GDP grew from $13T to $26.2T and India's GDP grew from $1.85T to $3.75T (estimated).

As you can see, the technology sector with the 6 companies in perspective, grew disproportionately by a factor of ~8 compared to the GDP growth by a factor of ~2. This represents 17.5% annual growth of technology businesses for 10 years in a row.

In the duration of Covid years, largely from mid of 2020 up until mid 2022, technology and countries experienced massive boost from the free money flowing into the system through stimulus spends, quantitative easing and very low interest rates. Besides the super high and unrealistic technology valuations, this led to a surge in how crypto currencies and digital assets like NFTs were appreciated.

Last 18 months changed the game. Between the Ukraine-Russia war, rising inflation, rising cost of fuel prices, supply chain crisis and rising interest rates, the liquidity tightened significantly. As a result, as witnessed, a lot of technology companies are restructuring or doing down rounds and the free money is going away. Many of the technology company valuations, which were valued at 15-18 times the revenue in mid 2020, saw a valuation drop to 3-4 times the revenue, at this point.

As we look into the future, major technology players will continue to prosper and possible valuations can grow to be 2.5 or 3 times in the next decade (from $10T to $25T-30T). As the valuations continue to grow, the players and the underlying enablement of technology platforms will go through a series of changes enabled by AI, Data, Compute, Power Efficiency and other Platform leverages.

Recently, I discussed 16 leadership development factors with my management team. One of the key perspectives that I expect leaders (and all the individuals) to be aware of is 'Macro/Industry trends'. It is imperative that we stay abreast of the modern technology stack, the data cloud, LLM shifts, leverage of LLMs on the new data sets, impact of compute (GPUs and Quantum Computing), strengthening our Security posture, Power Efficiencies, and evolution of Technology Macros in each of the Industry Verticals. These narratives will help us drive our strategies, thought leadership and representation of our brands/identities as individuals.

We also need to understand a Macro view of us as an individual, to know our past, our present and the trajectory into the future. Do you?

content:
Few inquisitive souls asked me for the list of 9 countries that still hold the AAA credit rating. They are Germany, Denmark, Netherlands, Sweden, Norway, Switzerland, Luxembourg, Singapore and Australia, with 7 based in Europe in addition to Singapore and Australia. This week, I am pulling together dimensions of Geopolitics, Macroeconomics and Technology representing shared intricacies between them.

Global order for Geopolitical Warfare, Economies and Digitalization in today's world is led by different entities.

Geopolitical Warfare Order: 5 decades back the power of warfare resided primarily between the United States and USSR. After the collapse of the USSR, the United States remained to be the powerhouse for quite some time. In recent years, following China's rise both in economic stature and warfare, many of the Asian countries are becoming stronger allies of the United States and are increasingly dependent on the United States. Similarly, following the Russia-Ukraine war the NATO driven EU countries are similarly becoming increasingly dependent on the United States. Defense/Wars have increased our dependence on technology to support Telecommunications (remember, the Starlink reference in Ukraine), cybersecurity and technology enabled weaponry.

Macroeconomic Order: This posture is multipolar compared to the bipolarity of the arms race illustrated between the US' ability to support wars globally and China's dominance in Asia. For the last few decades the US and China were interdependent for the supply chain and economic growth. Following disinflation (which can be a far bigger economic curse than inflation) and other macroeconomic shifts the today's world has many players that challenge the economic positions of the top 2 economies of the US and China. Between many of the big EU countries, Japan and the emergence of India, the Macroeconomic power remains distributed and will continue staying subdivided to be in a multipolar state. Digitalization Order: This is a very unique aspect which is not run by big economies but by companies, many of which have much larger market capitalization than the GDP of many countries. There is a staggering amount of world power that sits in the algorithms of these companies whether they drive AI based platforms, social media platforms or healthcare based innovations. Our world cannot afford this subdivision to deal with the crisis that the planet will face from weather and virus based threats.

Energy has been a root cause of economic growth and of many wars. Non-renewable sources have, if not depleting, have been impacting the environment in a big way. This necessitates significant innovation in both consumption efficiency of non-renewable energy sources and creation of renewable energy from solar, wind, and nuclear technologies.

Renewable Geothermal Energy Supply

A big new research underway is in leverage of geothermal energy. In the United States companies like Fervo Energy have initiated research to tap into clan, abundant power of geothermal resources using drilling techniques adapted from the oil & gas sector.

-   Traditional geothermal plants tap into natural hot water reservoirs underground to convert heat energy to electrical energy. However, hot water reservoirs don't exist in abundance

-   What exists is geothermal heat in hot and dry rocks below earth's surface so now we can drill into these rocks and create geothermal reservoirs by pumping water which can heated through fracking and produce geothermal energy

-   This energy can be provided 24x7 unlike solar and wind sources and emits no greenhouse gasses

-   More research is required to reduce the cost to scale this method, ensure that this gets state sponsorship from countries around and to understand the impact on water usage and to avoid earthquakes triggering from drilling activities

-   This innovation is a natural extension of oil & gas companies for them to be participants

Over the years technology companies have continuously increased efficiencies and reduced costs of their offerings. Snowflake has done similarly. It is possible only when the total markets, customer base, market share, and innovative offerings continue to increase. Brands, growth mindset & cultures do matter in creating new markets, new products and acquiring new customers. Are you attached to such a brand? Are you proud?

Expect the Unexpected: Iteration Velocity

While working with one my CEOs in the past, we would do two things in preparation of presenting to him:

-   Write all the research and highlight summaries in 80 words or less, with one slide to show: the Problem/Opportunity, the Ask and Potential Outcomes from making the choice or not

-   Secondly, after all the preparation, we would always expect the unexpected outcomes and questions from the meetings

Did Sam Altman and Greg Brockman expect to be ousted the way they were fired? Without judging whether the firing happened for the known Q* research potentially leading to AGI (Artificial General Intelligence) or any other reason, let's examine how they reacted to the situation -

-   First they quickly shared their appreciation for OpenAI employees, followers and wished everyone well

-   Their confidence in their own ability to move forward to the next phase did not deter them from what transpired, this is what I like to call Iteration Velocity

-   Sam mentioned in one of his tweets that he pretty much saw Eulogy post his death. He rose back like a Phoenix, quickly (https://twitter.com/sama/status/1725742088317534446)

-   Microsoft and the OpenAI internal org responded quickly however both, Sam and Greg, did not expect any such reaction. They demonstrated relentlessness

Bringing this back home, we cannot control what happens around us however we can definitely control how we respond to adversities. This needs training of your mind and body to have confident stimuli to events that ordinarily shake the ground below.

-   Sam could not control how they thought to determine his exit however at the face of it, he did Embrace Differences of Others

-   His commitment to Being Excellent was not a function of life events

Impacts of Geopolitical Conflicts on Global Economies and the Technology World

The ongoing conflict between Israel and Hamas in Gaza is marked by continuing Israeli attacks and humanitarian crises, with no imminent end in sight and international calls for a ceasefire largely unheeded. At the same time, there is a dilution in the attention to unending conflict between Russia and Ukraine. These wars led to high impact on energy costs, slowdown of global economies and significant investments that will be required to rebuild war impacted pockets of all the 4 countries involved.

Yet another conflict in sight is China with Taiwan and the potential impacts on the existence of our technology world. Many predict that this war is inevitable within a decade. Let's examine a bit more.

Neighbor's Envy

The People's Republic of China considers Taiwan a part of its territory. Taiwan, whose economy is largely defined by electronics, technology and export, maintains its own government and democratic system, with many of its citizens advocating for a distinct Taiwanese identity separate from China.

AI's Single Point of Failure

Semiconductor chips are the most complex mass produced objects that are built by humanity. They require purest metals, most expensive machinery, superhuman talents, and atom level manufacturing-precision. As such, there are two kinds of chip companies.

1.  Fabless companies, which design but do not manufacture their own chips. They include AMD, NVIDIA, Qualcomm and many others.

2.  Foundries manufacture chips designed by other companies. There are only 3 major chip manufacturers in the world: TSMC, Samsung and Intel.
    Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Limited (TSMC) is the only one that reliably manufactures AI chips with a market cap of $470B+ and is the 13th largest company in the world. It produces far more chips than any other company in the world.

TSMC makes all of the world's AI chips including NVIDIA GPUs, Google TPUs, AMD GPUS and AI Chips for Microsoft, Amazon, Tesla and a few others

Times Magazine describes TSMC as the world's most important company that you have never heard of. NVIDIA CEO Jensen calls out to say, 'basically there is airâ€¦ and TSMC'. TSMC is irreplaceable in a nutshell.

Impacts from such a war

China-Taiwan war can paralyze the AI ecosystem. TSMC's Fabs or chip manufacturing facilities are located on the West of Taiwan, merely 110 miles from the border of China. In addition, The United States has put massive restrictions on export of AI chips to China. Rest of the world is greatly incentivized in protecting Taiwan from China.

TSMC and other chip manufacturing companies in Taiwan cannot work in isolation as they are greatly dependent on algorithms and designs from other software companies around the world. They are also dependent on materials, equipment and services from other parts of the world. China is also greatly dependent on chips that it brings from Taiwan.

As much as recent time wars were super unpredictable, let's hope that diplomacy prevails in this dispute.

information and augment LLMs to generate **coherent** responses. As a
result, your retrieval mechanism is based on a specific dataset and
generation uses widely available LLMs.]{.mark}

triggering with the LLMs. In both cases of AI and Crypto the technology
moves/moved much faster than how quickly the governments react.

**What must the governments do?**

This necessitates that governments also lead the technology adoption in
parallel or in advance where applicable. Look at how UPI like
transactions and the implementation of digital currencies by some
countries will lead a new transformation. Will this possibly accelerate
de-dollarization? Only time will tell.

Next week I will touch upon the Agility and Value of work delivered
which I was hoping to write this time. However, the above thoughts
already gave a very detailed write-up. If you would like to hear about a
topic of your interest DM me and I will try my best to write something.

Enjoy the new week.

June 4 2023

Earlier in April this year, I started sharing my learnings with my
direct leadership team and coined it as 'Sunday Thoughts'. I am
expanding the outreach after receiving some input to share with the
larger audience.

**Where is AI?**

A lot has transpired with Generative AI this year, which has been a key
topic of interest for me along with macroeconomics, geopolitics and our
beloved Data Cloud. AI coin has two sides like anything else: one that
will probably reshape and displace jobs/industries and another side that
will stand up to beat the next pandemic, climate crisis, energy
challenges and asteroids. We need to embrace AI through constant
education and awareness.

More than a decade ago, I was introduced to terms like SDDC (Software
Defined Data Center) and SD-WAN (Software Defined Wide Area Network).
Virtual Machines enabled Software Defined Data Centers where these
logical machines were connected over Software Defined Network. We are
seeing a lot more activities in Software and Hardware driven AI
capabilities.

Recently, there were major announcements about the **NVIDIA Omniverseâ„¢
Avatar Cloud Engine (ACE)**. Let's examine this a bit more by reviewing
a few terms.

**Universe:** All of the space along with time context represent our
universe (Uni for one)

**Multiverse:** Multiple universes exist in a multiverse (parallel),
beyond our observable universe (Multi for many)

**Omniverse:** Collection of every single universe, including
multiverses represent Omniverse (Omni for All inclusive)

**Metaverse:** This is an immersive virtual world which facilitated by
Virtual Reality (hence Meta)

Now imagine, NVIDIA Omniverse Avatar Cloud Engine where Metaverse meets
AI. This as I understand is a single, shared, immersive, persistent, 3D
virtual space where humans experience life in ways they could not in the
physical world. Imagine physical factories for Chips (ICs), Batteries,
Electric Vehicles and others are virtualized/digitalized in an immersive
platform, they are now redesigned and improved in the NVIDIA Omniverse
ACE before the actual physical factories are changed. I am personally
excited to hear more about this at our Summit where we will have Frank
Slootman speak with Jensen Huang, President of NVIDIA. Hopefully there
is further intersection of our Data Cloud in this Metaverse at some
point.

Another topic on the leadership styles to review is the **'HIPPO
Effect'**. The HIPPO effect describes a cognitive bias according to
which the opinion of the highest paid person receives more attention. We
all deal with this situation many times and our leadership posture of
going (being) direct will make an oxymoron out of this context. I
encourage you all to not build a bigger HIPPO out of the leaders that
you interact with. This would mean that you need to find the **right
place and right time** to provide thoughts and inputs for you to be
heard. Don't be a yes (wo)man and figure out a way to share your
perspectives and don't use the watercooler to share your thoughts, go to
the source.

Have you seen a Hippo? Are you one?

May 28 2023

Do you realize how a lot of us stopped watching television news or even
reading newspaper news?

We have moved for news to be real-time, sent to us (compared to us
getting to it), and to become independent of traditional media houses.
One such change is evident on Twitter spaces. Recently, Ron Desantis and
Elon Musk discussed prior's US presidential candidature on 'Twitter
space', platform to engage in live audio conversations on Twitter. Many
of the traditional media houses cried wolf and botched on a 20 minute
delay in this engagement.

Between direct to citizen interactions encouraging citizen journalism,
creating break-out rooms and real-time tech enabled streaming,
traditional news media is challenged and changed. This trend will soon
follow in other geographies, my prediction, including India where the
access to smartphones and inexpensive data plans is also changing the
game.

On a separate note, the startup game in major technology hubs is
becoming a tale of 2 cities: this is a great time for AI based startups
and for other pre-AI/pre-bubble burst startups to shut shop unless they
are making revenues that far exceed their current investments. New
investments are still a function of a dream and the energy levels of the
founder.

Speaking about energy levels of a founder, did you know Musk offered to
sell Tesla to Apple in 2018 when its valuation was hovering around \$60B
to where it is now at \$600B+ today?

Lastly, I made some notes from Frank's commentary at the all hands

-   Twitter head count reduced from 7,500 to 1,800 and it still performs
    > superiorly

-   For all of us as leaders to be close to the action and take charge
    > inside the Data Cloud

-   For a consumption centric revenue mode, our forecast dropped by
    > \$100M for 3.8% downgrade in revenue and valuation took a
    > rollercoaster ride

-   Don't get to obsessed with your job titles/labels, just come and
    > work together (Don't create an identity crisis from self-created
    > expectations is my read)

-   Talk to everyone, ask questions and operate through influence - the
    > world takes note of this

-   Don't pull your badge out ever

-   When you feel objected, unpack the objection and go to the lowest
    > atomic level to gain clarity and resolution (primarily, this came
    > up as a response for sales cycle although this applies to all of
    > us)

Happy learning as we unpack a new week

May 21 2023

There was a congressional hearing in the United States last week to
appreciate the perils and the boons of AI. Congressmen/women interacted
with Sam Altman, founder open AI, prof. Gary Marcus and Christina
Montgomery, Chief Privacy and Trust officer at IBM.

Here are the key takeaways:

-   AI is not new but it is certainly having a moment right now

-   Composure demonstrated by these leaders was very profound,
    > relatively more open/engaging and humanly, compared to prior
    > technology hearings

-   There is a realization that we may have acted slowly with Social
    > Media to have massive organizations created and to have witnessed
    > many manipulations with the Social Media

-   There was a consideration to create both national and international
    > agencies to regulate use of the LLMs (Large Language Models)

-   Europe was ahead with Social Media and is also relatively ahead of
    > restricting the use of LLMs in geography. They also have presented
    > some version of AI regulation

-   Open AI model chatGPT 4.0 and subsequent ones will not be trained on
    > consumer data, which is a good thing

-   At this point in time, the LLMs are not validating the use cases for
    > copyrights and patents. For example, I asked chatGPT to create
    > lyrics in hindi for a love song mimicking Javed Akhtar's work
    > style. Bingo - it did so for me. What the heck?

-   At present there are many websites that are entirely created by AI
    > bots. There is a fundamental difference between reproducing and
    > generating content, as reproduction may have copyright and patent
    > infringements

-   As hard as it sounds, there is at least a mindset for governments,
    > public companies and scientists to work together in this forum.
    > Thoughts are around management of access, creation of right use
    > cases, moderation of models for culture and language inclusivity,
    > and managing to use AI for progressive use cases

-   The hard part is a lot of the smaller LLMs can also run on the edge
    > nodes which will make the whole process of regulations very hard

My aim is to remain engaged, appreciate the apprehensions and look for
building effective use cases, learn prompt engineering and use of models
with real-time data sets

May 14 2023

We figured that big companies grew organically and inorganically with
strategic adjacency. Let's understand aggregation, bundling and
unbundling effects for them.

Platform aggregators enable businesses through convergence of end users,
third party app builders and the platform itself. A few mentions on that
note:

-   Apple, us as consumers and companies that build applications on
    > AppStore

-   Google with YouTube as one of its platform, video publishers and
    > YouTube subscribers

-   Facebook for social media, eBay and Craigslist as marketplaces to
    > buy/sell goods and services

App builders and service providers are under constant pressure from
terms and conditions of the platform providers. This has led to several
new businesses created from unbundling opportunities.

Here are some examples of new businesses created from unbundling of
aggregators capabilities

-   AirBnB for leasing your property for the short term

-   Reddit as a sophisticated discussion form

-   Zillow and Redfin as real estate buy/sell. There are equivalent
    > companies in India

-   Tinder and Bumble for relationships

In totality the digital markets continue to grow, in many cases market
share (and valuation possibly) of the aggregators dilutes. Sometimes the
offshoot companies become bigger than aggregators. Take AirBnB and
Zillow (Real Estate) for example.

We continue to grow through aggregation though in the confinement of the
data platform and there are offshoot companies for data cataloging, data
quality, visualization and a lot more.

New businesses will continue to evolve from continuous aggregation and
unbundling effects. AI will accelerate this process.

Writing this note during rETL of my travel as I come back to post my US
Ux score across the hemisphere. You will see this note as soon as
Airflow orchestration pushes my workflow on slack. Ha ha, Data lifecycle
personified. See you soon

May 7 2023

How much organic (home grown) disruptive innovation have you seen from
large technology companies like Google, Microsoft, Amazon, Meta and
Apple in the recent years. Not much as far as I can tell. Apple created
iPhone in 2007, Google core search in late 90s, Google Maps in early
2000s, AWS has been around for a long while and Microsoft at best
created Windows in 90s. Most growth has come from acquisitions and these
companies have become large technology conglomerates as a result.

Google announced \$70B worth shares buy back from \$115B of its cash
reserves. Microsoft has executed a lot of share buy back in earlier
years. Meta bought back \$40B worth of shares.

Why does this happen?

-   Valuations are low enough for these companies to benefit from
    > invested in self

-   It is very hard to make foundational platform changes in these
    > companies

-   They are transitioning to being cash cows from main product lines
    > that have worked so well

-   Many of them have announced staff reductions to maintain high levels
    > of profitability

-   If you followed Microsoft and Google historically, there have been
    > so many regulatory interventions for anti-trust which discourages
    > deployment of capitals in competitive or adjacent capabilities

-   Meta has had an upshot in its valuations by 90% from this financial
    > engineering

Where is Snowflake? We announced a buy back of \$2B from \$4B (Jan '23)
cash on hand. One thing that makes us different as a tech company is
that we are not a tech conglomerate yet, still a singular platform and
we continue to innovate. Our growth is both organic and inorganic
through acquisitions, still within the conformity of our platform. Do
you remember from Frank's note that we are a platform and not a tool?

US - Sub 1% growth of recession - Jarome Powell

In response for the us govt and fed - Cut spending, keep energy cost
low, -

Inflation =\> function of money supply over amount of goods and
services; QE gave us more money and not having enough supplies leads to
inflationary situations

Record low people coming into the company; domestic citizens don't want
to do regular jobs; -

Cool of job market, cool of unemployment

April 30 2023

Sequoia Capital, US based early venture fund with \$85B in assets
invested \$21M in a firm named, **Harvey.Ai**. If you have watched
'Suites' you can imagine what the intersection of AI and Harvey can look
like. Good lawyers in the US cost \$800/hour and imagine that now a lot
of their work can be done by AI tools.

Likes of Harvey.Ai will offer legal services at a discounted rates,
perhaps 30-40% lower. This will also mean that good non-tech law firms
now have the opportunity to use these tools and provide 30-40% discounts
by augmenting AI capabilities.

Organizations, largely, as we look ahead will have an opportunity to
increase efficiencies by 30-40% or reduce costs by 30-40%, perhaps
something in between.

Let's go back in time. Imagine when MS Office was launched and we all
started using capabilities at some point in time. We would all have been
unemployed today if we had not figured out how to use MS Office in the
meantime.

AI offers the same opportunity to all of us, technology enthusiasts or
not. You choose to use it and you can be 30% more productive, although
let's differentiate between efficient and productive here. Efficiency
means you will do the same task in 70% of the time and productivity
means you can produce 1.3x in the time spent. Organizations can
differentiate between the two.

It is that time to take a leap of faith into the future, embrace AI and
make a transition. Curate independently, Use AI to Improvise and take
the outcomes of AI to Authenticate with your midas touch.

Have you taken the plunge yet?

**

Happy New Year to all. Let's get ready to ring in the new. A lot is
going on in the world as we wrap 2023 and here is yet another global
conflict in a nutshell.

**Expansion of the Middle East saga**

The Suez Canal is an artificial sea-level waterway in Egypt, connecting
the Mediterranean Sea to the Red Sea through the Isthmus of Suez. Suez
canal enables passage of more than 1,500 cargo ships every month,
primarily Chinese container ships moving towards Europe and the United
States.

To the east of the Suez canal are Saudi Arabia and Yemen. The Houthis
emerged in the 1990s as a Zaidi Shia Muslim armed insurgency group
primarily in northern Yemen. They represent a significant but unclear
portion of Yemen\'s population.

As a revenge response to Israel's military campaign in Gaza, Houthis,
with a likely sponsorship from Palestine supporting nations, recently
started attacking commercial ships in the Suez canal with drones and
missiles.

This has not only disrupted the trade routes but also risked the cargo
and the lives of the crew on board of the freight ships. This has
alarmed the US, the UK, Canada, France and other countries to raise
their guards to protect the commerce.

**Impact from this War**

This has increased the insurance cost for these vessels and the ships
are now diverted to go from Cape Cod in South Africa, resulting in a 20%
increase in time taken and has dampened the commerce.

Saudi Arabia, UAE, and Qatar intend to make the most out of their
natural gas in the upcoming decades to build the future of their
countries. The US has backed the Saudis in their war against the
Houthis.

This also further impacts China's already marginalized economy and
limits their ability to supply goods to the Western world. Europeans
will pay a bigger price for the products causing inflationary effects.
Remember, Russia is also a supplier of commodities and will be adversely
impacted.

**What can happen as a result?**

Houthis will not stop their attacks unless Israel stops and Israel will
not stop till Hamas is eliminated. This can plausibly lead to a larger
war beyond Israelis, Palestinians, Houthis and Saudi.

The cost of the war is also asymmetrical in that the drones that attack
the cargo ships cost in the order of thousands and the missiles that
defend them cost in Millions of dollars.

Air Freight is not an option either. A container ship can carry 10,000
40 Feet containers compared to 7 40 Feet containers that fit in a 747,
which is one of the largest cargo planes.

Yet again, similar to the China and Taiwan conflict that I wrote about,
Diplomacy needs to prevail here. A lot is going on. If you would like to
catch a glimpse of all that I read and watched over the holidays then
drop me a note.

Generative AI was a hot topic for the investors in 2023 and will remain

Before we start with AI, let's look back about 80 years before today. We
figured out how to harness controlled nuclear fission in the 1940s. Two
opportunities came out of it: for generation of energy from nuclear
plants and for building nuclear weapons. North Korea has many nuclear
weapons today but no nuclear power generation plant. Japan, the only
country against which nuclear weapons were used, has many nuclear power

content:
High Performing & Trustworthy Culture

This article is in response to a request to share how leaders enthuse trust while building high performing teams. Think of two simple dimensions: Trust and Performance. A rockstar employee demonstrates high trust and performs superiorly. If there is a non-trustworthy employee who is not performing then he or she will find it hard to survive over a period of time. Non-trustworthy high performing individuals can be equally dangerous, or more so, as they will build a non-coherent workplace for others around them.

It is easy to understand these pockets at a high level. However to establish a culture that builds consistently high performing organizations requires the whole village to play the orchestra.

Factors that Build Trust

Here are a few things that come to my mind:

1.  Communication: Successful organizations thrive on real-time and face-to-face (in person or virtual) conversations. This is a dialog and not a monologue from a manager to an employee. It needs to be engaging and must happen as close as possible around the event. This necessitates privacy, sensitivity and mutual respect in both directions. It is everyone's responsibility to initiate these dialogs whether you are an employee or a manager.

2.  Respect: Building a culture of objective and honest dialogs is the next level. Always, keep the issues in perspective and not the individuals. Most of us go through an intense recruitment cycle being an employee or if you apply the same mindset to your personal relationships outside your family then they also go through intensive evaluations over a period of time to be that special someone. You are where/who you are for a reason.

3.  Integrity: Confidentiality of conversations is extremely important. Coming back to keeping the issue and person separated, sometimes it necessitates leaders to share the origin, outcomes and fix of issues with the larger organization without naming/shaming any individuals. Leaders need to be effective listeners in these situations or otherwise, as listening is a much harder skill to develop for most humans.

4.  Support: Providing guidance, tools, navigation path and adequate time for people to be successful is essential. The world around us changes constantly and the methods/tools of yesterday become irrelevant over time. As a result, for a leader, it is extremely important to be cognizant that without an adequate development plan neither the organization nor she can be successful.

5.  Feedback: It is important to let individuals know where they stand and what improvements are required. Providing and accepting critical feedback is important to all of us as an individual or a leader. Ensure that this dialog happens in a very comfortable environment, as often as required, non-toxically and in both directions.

High Performing Organizations

Assuming that we all understand our role in building our trust with others and the larger organization, here are some key questions we must look at to build a high performing organization

1.  Initiative: Are you thinking outside the box? Do you understand the real impacts of your goals? Are you constantly challenging yourself to drive value from your outcomes? Do you understand if your goals connect to the larger goals of the organization?

2.  Adaptability: What are your stimuli like to the changing narrative of the world around you? Our life is constantly changing, especially within the organizational context of how many exponential changes happen in this world.

3.  Reliability: How do I demonstrate high quality, super-responsive and dependability traits?

4.  Collaboration: Most individuals, owing to an implicit competitive mindset, find it difficult to work with peers. High performing organizations thrive to score more than 2 from adding 1 to a 1. 10x thinking can happen in your dreambox however 10x outcomes do not come from individuals. Do you collaborate with others?

5.  Initiative: This is my favorite point of view. How do I find new ways for getting things done? Do I play the 10x productivity game? Do I find ways to optimize productivity? Do I share my best practices with others?

In the performance part I ask many questions for personal introspection.

A few techniques for continuous engagement and learning

1.  Connecting with Leaders: Powerful and influential people don't have time. If you get an hour with them then make the best use of every minute. If your conversation with this person becomes boring to her then you have lost their attention. Being a powerful leader, he/she should also build tolerance to enjoy the boring conversations.

2.  Social Skills: A friend on social/professional media can be unfriended. You can't unfriend a noisy neighbor or even a manager/colleague for that matter. If there is a noisy neighbor (or even a manager) you will need skills to walk into your neighbor's house with a cake to build a relationship and then address the noise issue. We have to constantly uplevel/upgrade our human skills, just like your smartphone or the apps on the device.

3.  Dealing with Unlike mindedness: Social media's AI engine and watercooler at the office will build natural affinity to your liking for the content or the people you interact with. Real workplaces are not designed like social media to put you in a loop of likings so you will need an open mind to build an open door culture.

4.  Humility: Humility is an enduring quality required especially for the accomplished bunch. You need to stop being the center of the world and think about the collective humility of your ecosystem.

5.  Self-Development: In the decade prior to right now, you could always predict what the world of employment (or livelihood) looked like for the upcoming 20-30 years with learning and academia in perspective. This is not true today and it necessitates learning and retraining all the time.

  Few decades back, imagine if a tractor replaced you on your farm, you could figure out what it would be like to be employed in a tractor manufacturing facility. This was a relatively low skill transition. This is not the case today. New jobs in arts, in creative fields and science streams require superior skills.

  If you look back in time, global inequalities have significantly reduced in the last few decades. With the rapid changes in the skills and technology landscape, there will be a burst of changes that will increase these inequalities. Opportunities will have significant gaps to address based on an individual's phase (middle-age vs. early in career talent), geography (knowledge/opportunities availability) and skill transition differentials (factory worker vs. knowledge worker)

Take some time out to ask yourself the questions for a high performing organization and introspect. Do you have other factors that broaden these thoughts? Do you have best practices/examples to share? Do you see (y)our organization and think differently? Looking forward to hearing your thoughts, as always.

Few of the thoughts came from this dialog with Yuval Noah Harari (Author of the Sapiens, Homo Deus, 21 Lessons for the 21st Century)

Defining Quantum Computers

Our computers today, the servers, the laptops and the smartphones are
built on bits (binary digits that are either a 0 or a 1). Quantum
Computers are built on Qubits which can be zero or one simultaneously, a
basic feature of a quantum computer.

Superposition: The state of being zero or one simultaneously is called
superposition.

Entanglement: These qubits can entangle with each other which allow
quantum computers to grow exponentially. 2 Qubits can store and process
4 bits, 3 to 8, 4 to 16 and so on. This exponential scaling makes
quantum computers far more powerful than traditional computers. In our
computers today, you provide input data in binary (digital) format to
process data and generate outputs based on certain algorithms. In a
quantum computer, the input is provided in the form of qubits that can
interact with one another. Leveraging Superposition (to be 0 or 1
simultaneously) and Entanglement of Qubits allows Quantum Computer to
carry many calculations simultaneously making it very powerful. Largest
quantum computer today can compute on 1,225 qubits and can represent
2\^1225 states simultaneously.

So what? Compared to classical Supercomputer capabilities which can
predict weather or do large scale machine learning, to avert greenhouse

viruses.

of personality inheritance. So, why all this?

Gene Editing with Protein Language Model

Scientists in Harvard and Berkeley in 2010 used CAS proteins to do
targeted DNA/Gene editing in plant and human cells. With the ability to
edit genes, we can kill diseases. T Cells in our bodies can attack
cancer cells or even change the structure of plants to increase yield
and make them disease resistant.

Gene editing requires constant search for CAS proteins though underway
for the last 10 years, it has been a slow process. Profluent, a company
with a tagline: 'We create bespoke proteins for breakthrough medicines',
created an AI model or Protein Language Model (PML), ha ha, to create a
new library of CAS proteins - they took 26 Trillions of Genome data
repository. Through the inference of this large data set they discovered
openCRISPR-1 protein which is now freely available as open source for
use and research. open-CRISPR-1 protein is 400 mutations away from
anything found in nature, discovered purely through inference on the
Protein Language Model. Do you remember how one or two mutations of
Corona virus created havoc in those days. We are looking at 400 such
mutations with a positive connotation this time.

Proteins make the precise cuts in genes/DNA and AI started to predict
which proteins would make a good gene editor to create dozens of gene
editing molecules.

databases and created a Protein Language Model on top of this - this
dataset can be downloaded and ingested. Profluent took 26T base pairs of
data to train their model; they used the model to run inference on it to
create CAS systems that are far more powerful and have efficacies
greater than CAS proteins available in nature.

free use, modification and distribution of Arctic even for commercial
purposes.

A dense transformer architecture like in Llama 2 or Llama 3 allows
learning from layers of information to integrate and learn from vast
amounts of data.

MoE (Mixture of Experts) divides the model into many smaller specialized
parts, each called an "expert". Each expert is good at handling specific
types of tasks based on the question's content. Similar to different
specialist doctors at a hospital for a given medical issue or in the
case of a data platform like us whether a question pertains to SQL, Code
or following complex instructions.

In Conclusion

The Arctic model provides a very high inference efficiency to allow for
practical deployment of our models at a low cost. At large, there is a
big threat in open source LLMs replacing search engines.

Have you played with our LLM at arctic.streamlit.app? I am still
learning as this unfolds. Are you? Is there anything else that can be
looked at?

Hardness of Soft Skills

Sandeep, our PMO leader, and I were catching up earlier last week and
the thought came up on the importance of soft skills. needs
improvement - Not only are the soft skills hard to acquire, it is much
harder to know how many of these each of us need to improve upon. I will
divide the write-up in parts to describe Incognizance or unawareness,
how to put them in practice, how they impact our lives and about the
hurdles of putting them to practice.

Incognizance

A friend had once told me how in his village, of course in India, when
the doors opened up at the movie cinemas, people would rush to get in
and to his surprise the rush would be to occupy the first few rows to be
the first ones to watch the movie. Ha ha... Let's move the same mindset
to the corporate world.

Similarly, have you seen how at the company all hands first few rows of
seats remain unoccupied due to the comfort found in the backbenches or
from the inherent mindset to avoid facial contact. I have also seen
similarly that during leadership dinners or events, very few gather the
courage to find a seat next to the host leader. Somehow this
undocumented law of corporate physics states that the distance from the
leader is proportionate to the layers in the organizational hierarchy of
the individual's position. Even in my staff meetings there is a usual
bunch that finds comfort in occupying the couch seats at the back. It is
often cited as, 'oh, this is very comfortable' and not realizing that
this demonstrates your innate inability to pounce on the seat at the
table.

This has often caused annoyance especially for the leaders that come
from a different culture or geography. My personal expectation is that
every employed individual must quickly learn to grab that seat at the
table, the first key to developing strength in your soft skills.

Expected respect for the elders in some cultures or the implied lessons
taught in traditional academic setup lead to these behaviors of not
finding your seat and become a roadblock for both the individual and the
organization's growth.

Putting them to Practice

Once you have your seat at the table, the first thing is to ensure you
are willing to and open to communicating. This necessitates having a
clear thought process, being objective and brutally honest about your
thoughts and to be able to speak up at the right point in time. Over the
years, as much as I expect crispness in a message, I have built a strong
mindset to focus on the message more than the messenger, especially if
English is not a primarily spoken language of communication for
individuals.

Secondly, people live a lot of life around 'he said so or she said so'
and easily deviate from the topic of purpose in the conversation or
meetings. Strong Emotional Intelligence in communicating with a purpose
is far more superior than your subject matter expertise. Did the other
person sense respect in your tone, did you focus on the core issue and
have clearly defined expectations and associated outcomes when
communicating?

Another key aspect is your ability to build productive workplace
relationships. Do you know people outside of their job designations? Do
you stay in the comforting company of usual suspects or build superior
relationships and new connections every day? Do you ensure to greet
people in the hallway?

On a very positive note, Mike Scarpelli, our CFO was greatly impressed
with the culture that we demonstrated in showing up for his all hands.
He witnessed an outstanding enthusiasm in the engagement and the
conversations. The reason for this mention is to leave a question for
each of you: Did you study about Mike and his role prior to his arrival?
Did you contribute to the collective enthusiasm?

There are many other facets of soft skills demonstrated in workplace
etiquettes, in your grooming, in showing up on-time, in following up for
your tasks and even letting people know in a timely manner when the
expected timelines cannot be met. Others don't like surprises as much as
our own dislike of them.

Impact of Soft Skills on our lives

Organizations and people excelling in these skills create a high
performing culture, have flawless and common understanding of complex
topics/initiatives at hand, they collaborate effectively with hand-offs
and provide great support to each other. Our collective problem solving
capacity increases tremendously and no goal remains unachievable.

Hurdles

The biggest hurdle in this can only be 'me'. Positivity rubs on easily.
Your being really good in these skills will bring reciprocation from all
others with much ease.

What is your assessment? Do you know your blind spots? Do you/we excel
with these? Do you ever judge others or just focus on playing your part?
Did I miss a skill that could be mentioned here or in another writeup?

Growth of Nations & People

India is predicted to be the 3rd largest nation in the race of Gross
Domestic Product (GDP) growth and its GDP is currently projected to
surpass \$4T for the year 2024. The United States, China, Germany and
Japan are ahead of India in this measure.

There are other measures in addition to the GDP of 'GDP per capita' (GDP
divided by the population), GVA (Gross Value Adds) and PPP (Purchasing
Price Parity). While the GDP per capita may be a lower number based on
the number of citizens in a country, there is also a factor of
Purchasing Price Parity which you can imagine from the ability to
determine what a rupee can purchase for you in India compared to a
dollar in the United States. A simple example can be in the form of
haircut cost in India which can range from 100 rupees to north of 500+
rupees at a fancy salon. Haircut costs in the United States can vary
from \$10 (830 rupees) to \$40 (4100+ rupees), or even more.

How is the GDP calculated?

As calculated with an expenditure based approach GDP of a country is
calculated as

GDP = C + I + G + (X - M) where

-   C =\> Consumption by all the households

-   I =\> Investments made within the country

-   G =\> Government Spending

-   X =\> Exports (Like Agricultural products or Technology Services )

-   M =\> Imports (Like Oil or Defense Spend)

While the numbers and measures will always have subjectivity, how much
better you are today compared to your yesterday matters the most,
whether you are an individual, a company or a country. Let's use this
analogy keeping people or let's say specifically each of us in mind.

situation. She expressed her inability to deal with a work situation and
expressed her vulnerability. We spent quite some time discussing the
matter and I provided some guidance to navigate certain situations. She
was thankful for me spending precious time out of my busy schedule. So,
what?

organization, reached out to me to say hello and to discuss her
opportunity areas along with some vulnerabilities. Essentially, she
networked with me. Keep this interaction in mind as we build a logic
around Personal Network Growth as a formula.

human-to-human orchestration. Let's define a measure as 'Network
Development Plan (NDP)' with a myopic focus on people and relationships.

NDP = C + R + I + (X - A) where

-   NDP =\> Network Development Plan

-   C =\> Content

-   R =\> Relationships

-   I =\> Investments

-   X =\> X Factor

-   A =\> Abscondment

purpose that you are attached to both your position and your
