-   Reminder of 5 Dysfunctions of a Team (Patrick Leoncini):

    -   Inattention to Results

    -   Avoidance of Accountability

    -   Lack of Commitment

    -   Fear of Conflict

    -   Absence of Trust

-   Build Right Products and Repeatable Sales Processes

-   Don't Outsource Recruitment

When you look at the leader list above, review with a lens for the
leader you will become, the leader you are and the help that you can
provide to your leader with these backdrops.

(Un)Attaching to People/Work

Frank's departure fits somewhere in Expecting the Unexpected Outcomes in
my book of experiences. There is so much that our new leader Sridhar
brings in the world of AI/LLM so more about that at a later point.

What is a good time to Move on:

Life Events: Most always, unless there is a compelling life event, you
need not look outside for a new opportunity. If you work for a great
company and a great culture then you will find something to do even when
there are life events unless you are going back to school.

-   There is no substitute for continuous learning. Formal academia
    > though helps give both structure and attention, is not the only
    > source of learning. Remember, meaningful experiences are far more
    > powerful than an MBA degree

-   With life events, good companies enable change in job profile,
    > geography or also create part-time opportunities. You need to be a
    > role model employee as well for this to happen

-   Your career rotation opportunities will be best presented within an
    > organization, most always

When do we actually do it and Why?

Most always, 'actual' decisions are not 'factual', but rather emotional.
We tend to find an escape route with discomfort arising from:

-   I cannot work for this person. We have heard many times that people
    > don't leave jobs, they leave a manager. While this might be
    > possible, you have a role to play here to address challenges
    > arising from such situations

-   A past colleague or an ex-manager is calling you

-   Better pay, different job, better work environment and promotions,
    > which may have their own perceptions

My point is to not discourage anyone to look for career growth; however
they cannot be an outcome of having a poor self-assessment or detaching
from your responsibilities to yourself and the greater organization.

What should we actually do?

-   Firstly, being honest to self and being self-critical is where
    > everyone must start

-   Engage with your manager(s)/management and have candid conversations

-   Be strongly aware of your own gaps with skills and expectations

-   Ask for help and support

-   Aim for superlative performance and a very strong personal brand
    > narrative

-   Understand the point of view of what your career will transform into
    > in 3 years, not a raise or promotion that you expect today

-   Eliminate distractions about monetary expectations. Remember, these
    > are byproducts of what you do and not preconceived expectations of
    > your self-assessed value

-   Build a powerful network of people that you can lean on to all the
    > time. Professional media will not respond to you in your
    > distressed situation

-   Build a 90 second elevator pitch of your brand to express how you
    > make a dent

-   Most importantly, focus on mental and physical well being, improvise
    > intellect (self-assessed) and look forward to life

A big thank you to Prasad Pagar for asking me to write about this.

Did I miss anything? Do you have a personal favorite POV? A story to
share? Looking forward to it.

March 3 2024

Here is part II of the AI/LLM write-up with addition of a few more
surprises and updates from this week.

AI is unfolding competition and platform challenges similar to what had
transpired in the search and the browser era. However, the impact on our
lives is much greater from these changes at least from what I infer.

Google Gemini: 'Role Model' Challenges in the Model Behaviors

Google rechristened it's AI platform from Bard to Duet AI to Gemini now.
Earlier last week, Google suspended its image generation capability
after it generated embarrassing and offensive results. They had to
publicly apologize for missing the mark as it tried to overcompensate
for diversity in the responses generated by the models, with the
underlying role model behaviors.

When we search for something with traditional search modalities, we are
offered an array of options usually, including some of the promotional
references. AI, on the contrary, has to give only one answer. Given
that, Gemini has come on the defensive mode and is asking users to use
Google search when responding to sensitive (even the ones perceived to
be sensitive) questions.

This might necessitate the reinforcement in the input interactions with
the models by providing a lot more contextual prompting, context setting
and reflection based response improvement. Models unlike humans will not
have delete capabilities, so you keep reiterating by asking the model to
improve its responses from reflections. Usually, 3 reflections lead to
improvements of a model's generation (example ChatGPT 3.5 to ChatGPT
4.0) however this also introduces a delay. In this instance, you are
using the reinforcement through an individual's feedback as compared to
general improvements that the LLMs make through Reinforced Learning from
Human Feedback, more as a collective representation from many humans.

In the email to his employees that publicly appeared on quite a few
social media, Sundar Pichai has vowed to make structural changes in the
company to address these challenges. This is an early phase of the LLM
life so certainly we will see a lot of learning and corrections in the
process.

On a separate note, Elon Musk is suing OpenAI and Sam Altman for
violating the principles and premise for its not for profit foundation.

Data: Growth, Relevance and Cost of Data Acquisition

It is predicted that the data grows at 2.5 Quintillion bytes on a daily
basis. 1,024 Terabytes make a Petabyte. 1,024 Petabytes make an Exabyte,
also referred to as a Quintillion byte.

About 10% of this can be estimated to be available on the internet,
which itself will be a large set to absorb and process for learning.
Also, more than half the data generated is not of much relevance to the
greater world. A lot of the data also sits behind platforms or media.

Google (Gemini) has contracts with Reddit (\$60M a year) and Stack
Overflow to consume data for its learning and use. OpenAI, post the New
York Times lawsuit controversy, is similarly making an agreement with
dozens of publishers to license content for training.

Many questions will come over time to know how these purchases will lead
to monopolies like Google search or not? Will investments in humans get
restructured to invest in contents? If the models are not deterministic
by definition how can one determine the value of the content purchased
through the LLM's Matrixed Black Box? Can/Will the content access be
explicit to some providers?

Fullstacks from Silicon Manufacturers vs. Silicon Manufacturing by
Hyperscalers

AMD GPUs offer competitive pricing and excellent performance for gaming
and general tasks. NVIDIA, however, leads in ray tracing technology and
AI-driven applications. The best choice to make will vary based on
price, performance needs, and software ecosystem preferences, making the
comparison not straightforward but rather contextual. NVIDIA has nailed
the game for the immediate future for sure as it offers a holistic full
stack platform that is beyond the chipsets for excelling in the LLM
space.

At the same time, following the lead of TPU/LPU conversation from last
week, imagine that AWS, Google, Meta and many more are aiming to build
and release their own inference silicon. They already have the power of
their full stack platforms. Of course, building a chipset is a very big
undertaking.

There is also a risk with NVIDIA GPU demand that if you used a platform
from another supplier your GPU orders may get deprioritized.

My Take on the Future: It is only bright

As we play at the intersection of Data, AI and Applications, I can only
say that the future is bright. This necessitates all of us to embrace
and know AI else you will be threatened from not being in the game.

-   NVIDIA sold \$22B worth of hardware, largely the GPUs in Q4. \$13B
    > in profits. Now this is huge, just in a quarter

-   This game is expanding. Even with other players/manufacturers of
    > LPUs or otherwise the game is getting bigger in terms of
    > investments in infrastructure

-   To implement and make the best use of \$22B worth of hardware will
    > need another 3x investment in resources. We are looking at \$88B
    > to \$100B of project based investments to deploy this hardware,
    > just from a quarter

-   This spend cannot be like just the toys for the boys. This will
    > generate at least another few Trillion dollars for economic growth
    > on an annualized basis. Just look back at what Microsoft, Cisco
    > and Oracle based infrastructure provided as propellers to tech
    > based economic growth in the past

-   This will also require platform based companies where you have one
    > stop shop that intersects Data, AI and Applications. You cannot be
    > mistaken as a platform by having 50 a-la-carte options. You cannot
    > expect your customers to interconnect your disparate capabilities
    > from inorganic/acquisitive growth

I want to end this note here with two key takeaways: Stay Invested and
Interested in the Modern AI/Data Stack and Platforms. You will be the
creators of the future.

As always, thank you for reading all the way through and will look
forward to your responses. Perhaps time to shift gears with an outlook
on economies/economics next week. Have a great week.

February 25 2024

I decided to catch up on my AI notes this week so this one will be
slightly geeky and macroeconomy based write-up. A lot of details so
ensure you are dedicating some time right now to be able to absorb what
is going on.

One thing to understand as a keynote of this message is that all LLM
models and many of the AI models are represented in the form of a
matrix. Capabilities of AI infrastructure are a measure of speed and
size of the matrices that are multiplied. This understanding will help
you appreciate the LLMs and AI Infrastructure for a very long time to
come.

NVIDIA and the Soar of Sora

With the skyrocketed revenues and growth, NVIDIA is now the 4th largest
in value behind Microsoft, Apple and Saudi Aramco. They reported
outstanding revenue growth demonstrating the high potential of the AI
world.

OpenAI announced the release of Sora, a prompt based video generation
capability. OpenAI's Platform now has the ability to generate up to 60
seconds long videos based on your imaginative narration.

Unreal vs. Artificial

'Unreal Engine 5', a product of Epic Games, which has existed much
longer than the realm of LLMs, creates real-time 3D photoreal visuals
and immersive experiences. Unreal Engine employs photogrammetry,
capturing multiple photographs of a real-world object or scene and
creates 3d models, capturing with it textures, colors, lights and other
attributes of the physical world.

Sora, as a natural extension of the Large Language model, creates videos
from prompts through training the model with a lot of real world
examples. It will be interesting to find out how the Sora models were
trained. They possibly were built from tagging and labeling the outputs
generated from Unreal Engine 5 mentioned above, and perhaps a few more
products similar to Unreal Engine 5.

Have you tried using 'Dall.E' or Midjourney to create images? Assuming
that the experience of using Sora will be very similar, each time you
ask to improvise an image or a video, the generated results through
improvisation are significantly different. For example if you ask Dall.E
or Midjourney to create an image and if you provide a prompt to
improvise the image for image or the text change in the image, the
entire image gets recreated in many ways. Each instance creates a
significantly different representation for improvisation. This is
because the rendering in AI tools unlike in photoshop, Unreal Engine or
Autocad, is based on Matrices. Traditional CAD and Image Management
tools are based on layers which are more controllable in nature.

Eventually, this will necessitate marriage of compute/layer trained
models like in Photoshop, Unreal Engine or Autocad with AI trained
models like Sora and Gemini. The objects rendered by AI/LLM models can
potentially become input to the traditional tools so that the black
boxes from LLMs can get a more flavors. Other way around is also a
possibility.

We have come so far so nothing looks impossible. With that, as promised
for a bit longer write-up this time, let's shift focus on the AI compute
narrative.

Future of AI compute

Let's go back to basics as we build this up.

CPUs and GPUs: CPUs (Central Processing Units) are used for general
purpose sequential computing. GPUs (Graphics Processing Units)
specialize in parallel processing with thousands of cores that help with
graphics rendering and machine learning. An example of NVIDIA GPU is
H100 which is designed for accelerating AI, High Performance Computing
(HPC) and Graphics.

TPUs (Tensor Processing Unit): TPU is a specialized hardware accelerator
designed by Google for deep learning tasks and is optimized for speed
and scale, outperforming CPUs and some GPUs in terms of throughput. TPUs
were designed in 2016 to accelerate speech recognition and search
algorithms. An important data point to introduce here is 100 ms of
improvement in response performance, improves traffic by 8% of a given
interaction medium.

Introducing Groq and the LPU (Language Processing Unit)

Jonathan Ross, who was one of the founding members of the TensorFlow and
the Tensor Processing Unit (TPUs) at Google is the founder of Groq.

What are the unique characteristics of Groq LPU (Language Processing
Unit)?

-   Groq is built on the FPGA (Field Programmable Gate Array) concept
    > used in the build out of TPUs. As implied in the name, Gates
    > (engineers - remember the days of circuit design and gates - this
    > is not a reference to Bill) are built to be Programmable
    > dynamically after manufacturing of the silicon.

-   For most of the AI and for all LLMs, matrix multiplication is the
    > biggest problem for improving the speed of execution

-   LPUs are built to perform inference at a very high speed

-   Understand that the models are already built, both in the open and
    > closed source format and the quality of performance is already
    > addressed. What remains is the speed of execution in using these
    > models

-   In the definition of CPUs and GPUs, we discussed parallel
    > processing. However for Generative AI speed requirements far
    > exceed the parallelization expectations. This is because to
    > predict 100th token of the response, it can only be done after the
    > 99th token is predicted

-   Each token prediction in Generative AI usually will have the
    > requirement to pick one from 32,000 available tokens. Imagine
    > response speed required to pick one token after the other from an
    > array of 32000 distinct tokens for each token pick

-   GPUs use external memory and LPUs use internal memories so they are
    > actually very fast andare speed intensive, especially to make them
    > helpful for Generative AI

-   Modern GPUs are built at 3 to 4 Nanometer scale and are incredibly
    > expensive, both to build and to buy. Groq LPU is built at about 14
    > Nanometer size. Understand that smaller the size greater the
    > complexity

-   GPUs generate about 120 tokens every second. LPUs generate about 240
    > tokens a second and the test version already is generating 330
    > tokens a second. This number will only improvise

What happens next?

Given this transformation, the LPU platform will possibly be acquired or
built by the mainstream chip companies. They may be able to compete
independently as well.

NVIDIA probably has little threat from the mainstream competitive chip
manufacturers however these alternative technology platforms will pose a
threat for sure.

I have more thoughts to actually create a part II of this write up for
next week.

So, what do you think will happen next? Let me know if this narrative
made sense after a long break that I had on my AI/LLM updates and if you
are excited to hear part II. I am super excited to write my next set of
observations and some predictions.

content:
Recently we replaced a subscription of a CBT platform with pay per use
methodology. Our apparent understanding of value created from a CBT
platform was invalidated from low usage. Vendor did not care to track
the usage as the commission from selling the software was seat based.
Ultimately, we did not renew the contract and the supplier keeps chasing
us.

Market Sentiments leading to Volatility in Stock Prices:

For having reported revenue lower by \$40M (\$9.13B reported vs. \$9.17B
analyst forecast), including 11% Year-over-Year growth, as an absolute
number just equating to less than 0.5% of the forecast revenue,
Salesforce.com dropped its valuation by a whopping \$40B (20%) in just
one day.

We have seen similar valuation movements similarly either as a big event
or multiple events triggering big movement in the valuation of the
company which directly correlates to the traded share price.

Why is it that Salesforce.com valuations and stock prices are beaten up
despite growths in revenue, customer base and profitability?

-   Market still expects continuous high growth from SaaS and high
    > technology companies which is not sustainable. The projection is
    > for Salesforce to grow at 7% Q-o-Q however this is not good enough

-   With \$9B in free cash flow for Salesforce the valuation is still at
    > 20x. Revenue to Valuation (Share Price) is still over 6x. \$237B
    > of market cap today compared to annual revenue of \$39B

-   Lot of expenses are reduced and the profitability of the company is
    > still high however the valuation is still beat up

Critical Indicators of Interest

While there isn't a specific one or two things to point a finger at,
here are some likely indicators. This theory will be applicable for all
the SaaS and technology spendings not just limiting to the
Salesforce.com situation

-   Economy is cooling off and as a result the spending is a lot more
    > tightened. Global GDP forecast is lower by 1.4%. US Federal
    > Reserve moved the interest rate from almost 0% to a number close
    > to 5% in a very short duration

-   Enterprises are very cautious about making investments in
    > multi-million multi-year contracts

-   Software Development is getting more commoditized especially in the
    > AI/LLM based world

-   There are considerations for both Build vs. Buy and cheaper
    > alternatives are evaluated

-   Companies are getting more conscious of software and/or seats
    > sitting on the shelf from under-usage. In some cases, a lot of the
    > paid features of a seat remain unused

-   AI capabilities offered by Enterprise scale SaaS software are lot
    > more expensive than what comes from open source models or
    > alternative AI platforms

-   Similar to client-server data center based software getting replaced
    > by SaaS offering, AI enabled stack will offer similar
    > opportunities to displace SaaS

-   To a large extent, 80% features are far more acceptable at less than
    > 50% cost compared to having precise software solutions

-   Somewhere customers are also envisioning pay per use (Consumption)
    > as opposed to pay per seat (Subscription) licensing models.
    > Seat/License as a proxy for value is no longer valid

So What? Here are some key questions worth evaluating:

-   Are we scratching the surface where machines are replacing humans?

-   Is the economy continuing to push us to do more with less? We always
    > have thoughts so however have we acted accordingly?

-   To a lot of the leaders growth is a function of headcount in the org
    > as opposed to the generated value or impact. Have you seen a drive
    > for creating value without involving more heads?

-   Trends show that founder run/involved companies do very well over
    > the long run. Similar to Jensen \@NVIDIA and Musk \@Tesla, Marc
    > Benihoff is still in-charge. Will he turn the game around for
    > Salesforce?

title: Emerging Markets Offer Next Growth Wave
content:
Ripe like an Alphonso and Age with Grace like a Vintage Wine

As a young person, you aim to ripe like alphonso, the king of fruit,
bursting with vibrant potential and energy, to make a mark on this
planet. As a leader, you want to be a seasoned mariner, with your wisdom
and unwavering resolve, to guide the teams through calm seas and stormy
waters and a keen eye on the horizon. Does this really happen? How do
you see the mirror to know when you don't get it right with others? It
demands authenticity and a natural self.

When you are artificially nice to people in socially awkward moments,
you may not know but under your hidden discomfort all of a sudden your
heart pounds and occasionally raises your blood pressure.

So, why this mention and where are the awkward moments?

You may find this situation in new relationships, in unchartered
territories with people and most usually when giving or receiving
feedback, especially speaking in the corporate context with your manager
or with your team member, at both ends of the equation.

Firstly, unknowingly, 'sugar' plays a key role in these. We most always
find comfort in being nice, in compliments and patronizing in
conversations with unnecessary positivity.

Secondly, most usually as a recipient, we start fidgeting, avoiding eye
contact with the presenter, we cross our arms, we may have an awkward
eye movement, we occasionally pull the chair around and palms possibly
get sweaty as the sucralose rubs on as a sweetener.

With these under the skin responses and when you are artificially nice
or someone else is artificially nice to you, you get awkward moments.
Most importantly, we experience cardiovascular stress, unknown to our
own physiology.

So, How should we actually deal when giving or receiving feedback?

-   Firstly, DO NOT patronize with unnecessarily nice feedback as you
    > are somewhere ruining your reputation

-   Ensure that you always have data and specificity to back your
    > qualifying statements

-   If I suggest that you do not use sweeteners, it also means that you
    > need not be rude in your interactions

-   When providing feedback to others start with small specific
    > constructive data points in a couple of dimensions

-   Stop giving generic feedback like you need to improve your
    > communications or you need to be more visible. Stop accepting
    > these as a recipient as well

-   Provide specific actions/recommendations that are time bound, event
    > bound, topic bound and support bound. An example could be - you
    > will present a product demo at the next quarterly all hands
    > meeting in August and I will help you prepare your pitch.

-   When providing feedback ensure the recipient's receiving antennas
    > are on (for her to be present in the moment), avoid attacking
    > weaknesses, identify how your feedback will help the individual,
    > be honest, be objective and as specific as possible. Ensure that
    > the ambience for the conversation is comfortable , perhaps even
    > informal location like a coffee shop

-   When you give a presentation and if you receive lukewarm 'great job'
    > feedback with claps in emojis then don't feel elated. Ask for real
    > feedback. As an audience be authentic in providing feedback to the
    > presenter

As you take this back with you, think about both pleasant and unpleasant
experiences, how you reacted as a giver or a receiver of the feedback.
You can raise the bar for the next interaction with these thoughts.

Find a mentor in someone who can provide honest and objective
perspectives. Where possible be one.

title: IPO Market Timing Matters More Than
content:
Happiness: Our deep rooted mind is happy if we are making progress with
life. Salary raise, recognition, peer comparison, new house, new car or
new assets are all implied elements of material progress and absence of
these events is perceived as lack of progress, which make us unhappy.

Inflation: Inflation is the rate at which the general level of prices
for goods and services rises, reducing purchasing power.

Annual Inflation: 2% annual inflation growth target was first adopted by
New Zealand in 1990, as proposed by Reserve Bank Governor Don Brash.
This has become relatively a global baseline in the last 40 years which
needs revisiting as inflation largely has surpassed this assumption in
the recent past.

Interest rates established by Federal Reserve Bank in the United States
usually tend to be higher than inflation rate. As a result, the interest
rates have been higher post the covid era following the inflationary
economy.

Liquidity of Capital: In order for businesses to prosper, liquidity of
money, which relates to access to capital, must be high. This largely
relates to the growth orientation of the companies.

So, Why all this?

Low inflation leads to lowe interest rates. Low interests will lead to
easier access to capital and better opportuntiies for busiensses and
economies to prosper. This will result in growth mindset especially for
the technology sectors and tie to prosperity leading to increased
happiness, which what human mind chases, largely speaking.

S&P 500 Index: The S&P 500 Index is a stock market index tracking the
performance of 500 large publicly traded companies in the U.S. It is
widely regarded as a key indicator of overall market health and economic
performance.

Markets: Looking back in the last 12 months, S&P 500 Index experienced
significant growth, reflecting strong market performance. From July 2023
to July 2024, the index rose from 4,450.38 to approximately 5,460.48,
marking an increase of about 22.7%.

So why did the index grow despite the high interest rates?

The \"Magnificent 7\" stocks, comprising Alphabet, Amazon, Apple, Meta
Platforms, Microsoft, Nvidia, and Tesla, have played a substantial role
in the S&P 500\'s performance over the past year. These seven companies,
collectively known as the Mag 7, account for nearly a third of the S&P
500\'s market capitalization. Their combined influence has been
significant, driving much of the index\'s growth.

In 2023, the Mag 7 stocks surged by approximately 75%, while the
remaining 493 stocks in the S&P 500 rose by only 12%. This stark
contrast highlights the outsized impact these tech giants have had on
the overall market. Without the contribution of the Mag 7, the S&P
500\'s performance would have been markedly lower.

For example, Nvidia led the charge with a remarkable 239% increase in
2023, followed by Meta Platforms with a 191% gain.

Monopolies: This disproportionate growth also shows how monopolies will
come into play. NVIDIA makes H100 GPUs worth \$30k a piece. A lot of
AI/ML infrastructure will have hard reference to their architecture.

We also experienced global outages in banks, airlines, finance, retail
and other industries owing to issues related to Microsoft/Crowdstrike
dominance.

In a Nutshell disproportionality of nations are now also reflected in
companies. For now, just be aware, observe and appreciate these
phenomenon

is an attached strategy of a Systematic Investment Plan. Largely, unless
you are an F&O (Futures and Options) player, you will invest with a long
term in perspective. Essential difference between a Fixed Deposit and
Long Term investments is a combination of fluid model, long term tenure
and the (dis)proportionality of results, of course there is always an
element of risk. Let's take this game to our personal lives.

Systematic Investment Plans involve regular periodic investment of a
certain capacity to invest in the form of money or efforts. Similar to
financial investments, effort investments need to be fixed and
continuous. This is the magic of incrementalism.

You need a very predictable investment in learning a skill, bringing
awareness of worldly realities, applying the skill/knowledge and driving
for measurable results/outcomes.

DANGERS OF INCREMENTALISM: When you chase for a certain increment (pun
intended) or a promotion, you tend to put outcomes ahead of efforts and
this leads to gratifying short term gains and long term disappointments,
unless of course that brings happiness.

The key difference here is to state that investments have to be
incremental. In order to have non-linear returns, outcomes or
expectations need not be either short term or just incremental.
Disruptions or Transformations happen only with a long lasting
perseverance, whether it is to do with building an LLM or discovering a
cure for cancer.

ACUMEN and TIMING : Acumen is a function of knowing where to invest, how
much to invest and appreciating Return on Investments at the right time.
You need returns to buy a house, for educational loans or to make bigger
investments for the future.

Acumen to know where to invest money or efforts has to be very selective
and to not follow someone's lead blindly. This needs a solid awareness
of goals first, navigational path to source knowledge, execution
framework and of course a support structure to lean for guidance.

Another thought that came my way, especially over the weekend as I
pursue my next phase in the journey, is this one critical question.
Whose Inbox do I exist in, e-mail or mental? Once you have made your
investments, gained incremental knowledge over time, and generated
returns/value, now is the time to look for compounding effects. With
finance you need a new investment model and with professional drive, you
need to know who you know or rather who knows you? Do you navigate to be
present in their mental or electronic inbox (e-mail)? Compounding does
not happen without this, your knowledge will stagnate with you without
being able to navigate and communicate.

There are many ways to arrive in someone's mental inbox which I will
write about at a future point.

CONCLUDING: Are you looking for that F&O like iPhone perk from a new
opportunity or building a long term corpus? Remember, in ROI there are
no returns before the investments. So do you have an SIP? Whose Inbox
are you in?

If you would like to continue receiving these thoughts just drop a note
on my LinkedIn inbox with a preferred email address to receive these.

title: Modern Governance Demands Stakeholder Focus Now
content:
By now we are aware of Tesla, SpaceX, The Boring Company, X (formerly
Twitter) and StarLink as some of the Elon Musk businesses. He continues
to work on what the future holds.

Not so talked about and relatively new initiatives from Musk include
Neuralink - built to alleviate human suffering while expanding
capabilities of human mind, Optimus - the Humanoid Robot, desire to
build a human colony on planet Mars and finally the buildout of
'Gigafactory of Compute', the world's largest supercomputer.

Buildout of 'Gigafactory of Compute' is 750,000 sq ft in Memphis, state
of Tennessee and is on an accelerated timeline to complete in 2025. This
supercomputer involves 100,000 GPUs which are all connected to each such
that a GPU can talk to any of the other GPUs in the cluster. This likely
represents a human brain that humans can actually see, analogically
speaking. Similar to the human brain, gray matter is represented by
compute blocks and cables connecting the GPUs represent the tissues of
the white matter. Human brain has 60% white matter which is equivalent
to cables and these cables similar to the tissues are responsible for
carrying signals inside the brain.

So, why compare the Supercomputer buildout with the brain?

To achieve AGI/ASI (Artificial General/Superhuman Intelligence), we will
need access to extraordinary computing capacity.

Additionally, the AGI buildout supercomputer will also support
Neuralink. Neuralink will improve AI-Human Symbiosis and solve
neurological issues that humans have.

1.  It can bypass damaged neural pathways and facilitate direct
    > communication between the brain and external devices

2.  It can cure blindness by directly triggering the neurons in the
    > visual cortex

3.  Eventually you can augment human brains to increase human output
    > rate by increasing the number of electrodes/channels using the
    > neuralink

4.  Make human eye see different wavelengths beyond the ordinary to
    > create infrared eagle vision and more

Beyond Neuralink, AGI/ASI scale can be initiated on this Gigacomputer.
On the podcast mentioned below, they joked saying, machine interacting
with humans will be like humans asking the plant: I want to make it
happy but it is not saying a lot.

How are GigaComputer and other major initiatives implemented?

Here are the basic Principles/Algorithms as narrated by Musk for an
intense drive to improve the product process of the Supercomputer build
out and others.

1.  Firstly, make requirements less dumb. No matter how smart the person
    > who gives requirements is, there is some dumbness to it. You don't
    > want a perfect answer to a wrong question. So, always question the
    > requirements

2.  Now, delete some part of the requirements. If you don't delete at
    > least 10% of what your process is then you are introducing
    > inefficiencies. People feel successful at the start if they are
    > not asked to remove things that they have put in their request

3.  Once this is done, further simplify and simplify the process in the
    > design. Most common mistake that smart engineers make is to
    > optimize the process that should not exist in the first place. You
    > may in your design and requirements eventually put things back
    > that you may have deleted in the first place. Deleting the
    > requirements or a process step introduces pain for the user or the
    > designer respectively. You need to tell them that some of the
    > things that we delete we may put them back in however without this
    > first principles thinking your product will not be simplified

4.  Any given thing can be sped up. There is always a faster way to get
    > things done. You don't get to speed up (improvise schedule) up
    > until you have simplified and optimized, both the requirements and
    > the design

5.  Finally, automate. Now it is important to realize if you don't
    > follow this approach you may automate something, think of speeding
    > up and then eventually realize that in order to optimize you may
    > delete something that was not needed in the first place.

Critical Success Factors

AI Computing infrastructure is a voracious [user of
water](https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2023-07-26/extreme-heat-drought-drive-opposition-to-ai-data-centers)
and
[power](https://www.washingtonpost.com/business/2024/03/07/ai-data-centers-power/),
and the environmental downsides of hosting these mega-machines is a
source of growing concern. xAI facility in Memphis will need to use
roughly 1 million gallons of water a day and up to 150 megawatts of
electricity

â€‹â€‹Globally, computer processing is adding a worrying burden on energy
resources, and demand is anticipated to keep surging. In Ireland, for
example, data centers [consumed 21% of the nation's electricity in
2023](https://www.theguardian.com/world/article/2024/jul/23/ireland-datacentres-overtake-electricity-use-of-all-homes-combined-figures-show).
with a huge amount of greenhouse gas emissions.

While there are planet changing initiatives that will be implemented on
the modern AI technology stack, the modern stacks of Crypto, AI and Data
Centers play a tug of war with greenhouse gas emissions.

Your job in this space is to keep an eye on these contradicting
elements, remain engaged with the stack build out especially with the
inference stack and be excited about the future as AI evolves and leads
us to AGI/ASI (Artificial General/Superhuman Intelligence).

title: ESG Investing Moves Beyond Compliance Checkbox
content:
Questioning the Definitions:

Today, I am writing about how I questioned some definitions to
understand a few recent concepts. Here we go.

Imagine you are doing a 'Subject Matter' talk or a presentation. In
preparation you have a structure based on a flow or your knowledge based
on which you have prepared your talk.

What makes a Tech Deterministic or Non Deterministic?

Deterministic Tech produces the same output for a given input every
time. Traditional algorithms and rule based software follow specific
instructions and provide predictable results.

LLMs are trained on a variety of data sets and the inference or
responses of the model rely on probabilistic algorithms to generate
responses. Given that token generation is sequential (100th word of the
inference is not predicted till the 99th word is generated), LLMs
generate varied and creative responses for each 'ask' just like a human
brain would.

As a presenter: In the mock of being a presenter you have studied your
subject for years and this makes your talk super predictable in the
context of your preparation and material to be shared.

Why do the models hallucinate in that case?

Models respond to training data and not factual accuracy so it makes
them predictive, leading to incorrect or nonsensical responses. They
cannot make real-time verification and hence just like a human would (we
all sometimes say nonsensical things) model would do the same.

Now when you are reciting tables of mathematical numbers you are always
referring to some verification or validation so you will not tend to
hallucinate due to finite factual references, unless of course you are
making a genuine mistake.

As a presenter: Now imagine that in this session someone asks you a
question and you are not sure of the answer. You may answer it
subjectively with some abstraction or defer the question saying that you
will come back at a later point.

Fundamental nature of LLMs is poised to be an accurate specialist and as
a result unlike human responses, language models may hallucinate and
give an incorrect response. Imagine how many people will come back to
your 'specialist' talk if you hallucinated and said 'sorry' let me try
this again.

Similar to answering mathematical questions, how can models be made more
accurate or more deterministic?

Models can be improved with techniques like Retrieval-Augmented
Generation (RAG) where the models retrieve relevant, up-to-date
information from external sources before generating a response. This
ensures fact-based responses from being trained on a specialized
dataset. This will mitigate hallucination and provide far more
trustworthy outputs.

As a presenter: In this situation, many times leaders take along
specialists and use them similar to RAGs to provide qualified responses
after providing initial directional thoughts.

So What? In your pursuit of life, you need solid subject matters to be
'out there' that come from training and many instances of responsive
inferences. You will often get stuck and you will need to better prepare
to infer (imagine at meetings), to respond (show up), to reduce
hallucinations (keep mum when you are not sure), to train yourself (find
where you fell short) and finally use support (of experts and your
colleagues) to make an impact. Do you?

title: Stakeholder Capitalism Challenges Shareholder Primacy Model
content:
Understanding the Recent Economic Turmoil

Carry Trade: A carry trade involves borrowing money in a currency with a
low-interest rate and investing it in a currency or asset with a higher
interest rate, profiting from the difference (the \"carry\"). This was
evident in the recent findings as many investors borrowed from almost 0%
interest Japanese Yen and invested in high yield assets, especially ones
attached with the US dollars.

Following chart shows how the median population has trended in 3 of the
geographies, namely India, Japan and the United States that I considered
for this write-up. As you can say, the current median age of the
Japanese population is significantly higher than that of the United
States and much higher than that of India.

![](media/image22.png){width="6.5in" height="4.25in"}

Let's also look at the ratio of national debt to GDP ratio for these
countries

![](media/image21.png){width="6.5in" height="4.194444444444445in"}

In a nutshell, you see that the debt for the United States and Japan, as
compared to the GDP, has significantly grown and remains unmanaged.

So, what? This essentially shows that between the aging population, cost
of servicing the debt and inflationary impacts both Japan and the US
have an uphill battle to run their economies. If not corrected,
countries like India will have a similar outcome in 2 decades from now.

What triggered the global economy in the last 2 weeks?

Two weeks ago, the Bank of Japan decided to raise its interest rates to
0.15-0.25% from 0%, for the first time in years to curb rising inflation
and stabilize the yen.

Going back to carry trade, the borrowed capital in form of Japanese yen,
now becomes expensive. As the governments would service the debt, your
need to serve the loan payment for borrowing in Japanese Yen now has an
interest payment and an additional economic uncertainty from any future
rate increases.

If this was borrowed at 0% and invested in the US bonds at 4-5% you are
making roughly an annual gain of \$40,000-\$50,0000 against a borrowing
of 1 million dollar equivalent. The larger organizations who use this
leverage are interested in a lot more than 4-5% gain. Their game is much
bigger. How?

-   Now imagine that borrowings are much larger in billions

-   Borrowings are against collaterals like assets and equities

-   Borrowed money is then further leveraged to invest the borrowings in
    > F&O (Futures & Options). Simply stating, the borrowed capital is
    > invested in proportionately much larger investments than the loans

-   Now, all of a sudden when the Bank of Japan announced this raise in
    > the interest rate, there is a rush to cover for making the loan
    > payments both in actual and speculative modes

-   This rush creates a pressure on all the asset classes including real
    > estate and equities. As you can imagine, equities are much easier
    > to exit from than other fixed asset classes

-   F&O algorithms resulted in a very aggressive sell-off of equities
    > worth billions \$.

-   Hence you see a mode where there are significantly more sellers than
    > buyers (beautifully explained by Nilesh Shah at Kotak Bank
    > -https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=VY8sXX-QKME)

-   You saw a major sell-off in the global markets as a result

Seeing this major sell off and uncertainty, the Bank of Japan decides to
hold on to increasing the raise in the interest rates. What were they
thinking?

Markets have stabilized since then although the uncertainty of
macroeconomic situations still holds and on a separate note, there is a
looming danger of the United States entering in the recessionary mode.

What is in it for me/you?

Recession in the US will impact the world and the attached ripples will
be experienced by all of us. This will create both opportunities and
repositioning needs for your personal portfolios. Will the reversal of
decision by the Bank of Japan lead back to the 'same old same old'
borrowing. Keep your eyes and ears open. This will impact all of our
lives where we live in this globally connected/impacting world.

title: What Your Week Says About You
content:
What does your week look like?

Most of us 'working professionals' are trained to start the work week on
Mondays, check on things to do for the day or the week and just jump
start. For those who are super apprehensive about the food chain
sentiment, our work emotions are driven by the boss' mood swings, her
agenda or sometimes we rejoice from them not being around for the week.
We have a finite set of choices to begin the week or the day. Comfort
leads to this Auto-pilot. A week may also have intersperses of workout,
breaks, and family routines. Week ends somewhere between Thursday,
Friday or Saturday and then there is some unwinding before the cycle
resets for yet another Monday.

So, Why this?

Some people love the predictability of life. For me especially, 'change'
is far more comforting than routine. Our routine life also needs
discipline, however this will keep you cruising and just let you be. I
want to address the requirement of intensity to discover the next
version of us. The growth mindset.

Importance of 'Change'

Environment around us goes through constant changes, some of them are
significant life changing events. Think of how life has changed and
challenged us through the covid pandemic, the following supply chain
crisis, government intervention through stimulus, economic growth, major
policy changes to manage inflationary and disinflationary impacts, the
wars, the energy and the weather crisis and of course, the evolution of
AI/LLMs. These events have forced changes in our work environments,
lifestyle choices from being stuck at home and riding the associated
'monetary' tidal waves.

One part of me wants to learn and appreciate the changes and the other
part is to change myself. You can be a change catalyst in two ways.
Firstly, appreciate above events and make changes to your work and life
models: we learnt how to work remotely to where we have reached hybrid
work styles, we leverage the AI and new-age tech tools to accelerate our
work journeys, we made investments to leverage major geopolitical or
macroeconomic events and lastly but most importantly to recognize the
importance of human life and health from the perils of the wars and the
pandemic.

Secondly, in addition to leveraging these changes in our existing life,
life itself can change through these. Disruption in the hospitality
business with AirBnB, Full Service Autonomous vehicles, Media
consumption through OTT streaming compared to traditional cable
connections and dreaming to colonize Mars would not be possible without
this mindset to change the world.

Two thoughts in conclusion

-   Effort is everything: World around us moves very fast and if you
    > want to sit there thinking that you are better than man of the
    > worst performers then you will keep cruising

-   Wandering Mindset: I came across this Ted talk that shows how to
    > 'hack your brain for better focus', you need not just workout or
    > meditate but also let your mind wander from a thought to a
    > thought. It will bring a much needed breadth.
    > <https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=PBaFURjVrm0>

So, are you ready for a change as the new Monday begins tomorrow?

title: Prepare Workforce Before Disruption Hits Hard
content:
Matters Of Mind

Many of my wellwishers suggested that I take a break this time around. I
have been working for over three decades and have never taken a break in
between my jobs. So, for the first time, I am on a break. At any given
point either, I am rejuvenating or anxious. Rejuvenating to recharge or
anxious to think about what's next? Should I be recharging or just stay
busy looking for my next career opportunity? Honestly, I think this one
needs a placebo.

Change your mindset, change your game

I came across [this](https://youtu.be/0tqq66zwa7g?si=0eoeA_Wp6u5HeROI)
ted talk by Dr Alia Crum where she shares how our thinking determines
our body's response. She shares four beautiful illustrations showing
positive psychological and physiological responses from placebo's effect
on patients, love for their job by the housekeeping staff from exercise
benefits of their work, ghrelin level drop from description of how the
milkshake was made as low calorie sugar free recipe vs. high fat high
calorie recipe, and lastly how dealing with stress leads to peak
performance.

In case you are not aware, the placebo effect occurs when a person
experiences a perceived improvement in their condition after receiving a
treatment with no therapeutic value, driven by their belief in the
treatment\'s efficacy.

Ghrelin is a hormone that stimulates appetite, increases food intake,
and promotes fat storage, often called the \"hunger hormone\" because it
signals the brain to induce feelings of hunger.

So, Why this?

One of my readers asked me to write about the 'perceived' value of the
work we do.

Similar to Dr Crum, let's think about four possible situations:

1.  First, let's imagine that there is no recognition or appreciation of
    > what you do. Zero. Nada.

2.  Manager and Management is deeply appreciative however you are
    > unsure. So you think that you are not appreciated as there is no
    > acknowledgement.

3.  You get recognition and appreciation from the leadership, all the
    > time. This keeps you elated and makes you really happy about the
    > work you do, just like the housekeeping staff knowing that they
    > exercise regularly by the virtue of doing their job.

4.  In the last instance, even if you receive real or 'sugar coated'
    > acknowledgement of the work you do, you are self-aware and
    > self-critical of the work that you do. You believe and have strong
    > awareness of your ability to move the needle.

Which situation would you rather be in, of the four of the above. Some
of you may want situations 3 & 4 both and most evolved individuals would
look for only #4.

So let's conclude with the 'Matters of Mind'

-   While there is no suggestion to not exercise or to not follow the
    > diet, our psychological and physiological states are definitely
    > influenced by the mind.

-   Should I be having fun in my sabbatical or be anxious for my work?
    > Neither - just be cognitively aware of both the pockets

-   Should I always be stressed as it gives me peak performance? Not
    > quite, just be aware that stress is not always a bad thing

-   Lastly, imagine you are (like me) looking for a new opportunity,
    > would you rather be in #4 of the 4 situations or tell about your
    > value to the outside world only based on the validation from your
    > food chain.

title: Upskilling Differs Fundamentally From Reskilling Approach
content:
Spend Spectrum, Cost of Living Adjustments and Purchasing Price Parities

A friend of mine from Mumbai met me today in Lonavala, which is a
relative mid-point between my house in Pune and Mumbai. Since we were
meeting with families after a very long time gap, we decided to go to a
fancy wine & dine place. I had called for a driver to drive us so that
we could enjoy our drink and drive home peacefully. Upon return, I asked
my driver how much I owed him for his lunch as I wanted to pay him
allowance for his meal and more. He said that was about 100 Rupees
(\$1.20).

I was humbled by two things: His honesty as a first thing. Secondly, how
cost effective his meal was compared to the embarrassment it would cause
for me to write how much we spent on our lunch.

In another situation, I wanted to buy a recliner for my TV room a few
years ago. I went to a fancy European furniture store and the saleswoman
tried to sell me this expensive recliner chair which was a little more
expensive than a modest sedan car one could purchase. She told me even
Kartik Aryan, a celebratory Indian film star, has this recliner. I had
no idea of who Kartik Aryan was and irrespective of that I decided to
purchase a cost effective option. The Danish option of the recliner was
to be made to order and handmade in Denmark, which obviously would
involve both meticulous quality and cost of European labor.

As you move from the Northern Europe to the Southern Europe to some
Asian countries and eventually to the South Asian subcontinent you will
experience the purchasing price parities, spend spectrums and cost of
living adjustment with unit costs coming down as you pan through the
chronology of these geographies, as described.

So, What? How does this similarly impact the rest of the world?

As I write this, Volkswagen company (VW), a parent auto-manufacturing
company of brands including VW, Skoda, Audi and Porsche, is considering
shutting its manufacturing plants in Germany. Between the pandemic, the
supply chain crisis, and the Russia-Ukraine war the European and German
economy especially have been hit hard. (Dis)parities exist between
Europe and Asia as well as between Northern and Southern EU nations.

Between the rising costs of labor, factory ecosystem in Europe and
threats from China based EV companies, VW's business is threatened. VW
can't sell as much in China anymore, EVs made in China are imported to
Europe and most importantly even the VW's China made EVs are levied 38%
import duty in Europe. All this has made the business harder for VW.

So what does VW do? They decide to shut their German plants down and
plan to reduce expenses by \$11B in the next 2 years. This will have
implications - firstly, it will directly impact the employment and GDP
in Germany. VW is just a symptomatic representation of what is happening
with other companies and EU countries as well. Possibly the negative
growth movements will lead to a recessionary state of additional Western
countries including the United States.

Governments and Federal Banks are under extreme pressures to reduce
interest rates to keep their economies afloat.

Global Capability Centers (GCCs) in India

These situations of shifting workloads out of Europe creates
opportunities for the world to draw some balance. GCCs, which many of
you are part of, represent 1%+ of India's GDP and this contribution from
the GCCs continues to grow. There will be opportunities to build more
technology, design, and manufacturing units in cost effective
geographies. This will need the governments to offer increasing ease for
doing businesses, gain political stability, industries to create talent,
assure quality and get ready?

Your takeaway from this is to firstly acknowledge the global
recessionary sentiments, impacts and opportunities this will create and
plunge in when the opportunity knocks your door. Of course you will need
to dress up in overalls, roll up your sleeves and be ready. Are you?

content:
'Internal' Neuralink: Connecting with your mind

Neuralink, an Elon Musk company, is building a brain-computer interface that can bypass damaged neural pathways and facilitate direct communication between the brain and external devices.

I came across two really great talks and picked a third from my past life to connect a few dots. What if there was a linkage mechanism like Neuralink that can super-accelerate your connection and engagement with the external world. I am sure that there are thousands of such talks, however my intention at this point is just to provoke thoughts in order to achieve this acceleration.

1. Your body language may shape who you are (24 Minutes)

Amy in this talk mentions "power posing," where adopting expansive, confident postures for two minutes can boost feelings of power and reduce stress. It raises your testosterone and reduces your cortisol. You fake and infuse confidence in your posing and thinking not just to make it but to become it. This authentic change will foster personal growth and empowerment. This internal wiring and preparedness can then leverage your body posture and expressions to further make seamless engagement with the external world. How?

2. You are (or can be) Contagious When you meet a person first, what do you look at? Face, Shoes or Body. Not quite, they look at your hands first. Your hands speak a lot - a hawk, a defender or someone who welcomes. Now I figured what it meant to welcome with open arms. They look at whether you are holding a rock, scissor or welcome/warmth. If you can't see someone's hands you can't see her intentions. Greatest of the Ted speakers use 465 hand gestures in 18 minutes. Your brain gives 12.5x weightage to other people's hand gestures. Our implied and expressed emotions, fears and intentions are contagious. When you smile artificially with just your mouth open and naturally with your mouth open stretching your cheeks all the way to your eyes, you look more welcoming. Try it. Lastly when you speak what matters is the deep rooted tone of your intentions. All in all to accelerate your messaging to the outside world, from the thoughts so far, your power posing matters and then you exponentiate that with your niceness. The magic continues.

3. The Problem With Being "Too Nice"

Now when people speak, you can know easily when people are being nice artificially or naturally. When someone speaks about your shoes or your attire, you can most always tell how much of that is natural or artificial. What does one want to hear?

The spoken feedback loop is also a very difficult layer to lay over your posture and expressive niceness. Imagine an interpersonal dance when we give and receive feedback. Tough feedback without honesty and nicety creates discomfort in the recipient's body language. Shrunk body or pulled back chair. It is a lot easier to give general feedback: You did great, keep doing what you are doing, I love your sense of humor and a lot more while actually not giving honest feedback. Imagine, someone at your work tells you to take more initiative. Whatever that means - lord save me at that point.

Try to be honest and tough at first. Start with the positive part of the content (you did great, the topic was awesome, your confidence was very high), move to the net neutral aspects next (you could have changed the order, used a different font or a more impactful set of words) and finally lean into the constructive part. Recommend replacement behaviors: You talked about a great topic although you could have provided a course of action. They did not walk away with the understanding that you had intended to conveyâ€¦. I am sure there is more.

Take away from here: You see that the whole process of impactfully engaging with the external world is and can be very cyclical. Your inner wiring, your body language, your warmth, your message and the construct of it. The feedback loop too. I am amazed at how we exist. Take feedback from people you work with and find out if they see you as a package or if you see a package somewhere in someone.

As always, do write back and share your feedback. Let me know what else I can think about.

content:
Magic of 90

Following the US election drama in the last few weeks, I wondered what it must feel like to be in the transition phase of about 2.5 months between the announcement of the result and the actual point in time when the new president-elect moves into office. When both the leader and the ruling party change, there will be many opportunity windows.

-   For the departing leader, to implement the last set of desirable actions

-   For the arriving leader, to start defining the canvas of the new term roadmap and

-   Most importantly, for the arriving leader to understand the impact of the departing leader's actions on the new term roadmap

Stakes are very high in such transitions. It made me realize that all of our lives, personal and professional, can be managed as chunks keeping similar perspectives. Before I get to labelling these 90-day units, a few plain basics.

Plain Basics

John Thompson, one of my CEOs from the past, got us a T-shirt labelled 'This is the most important quarter of the year' with no specific date. It made me realize for the first time that personal growth is non-negotiable and must be continuous.

Earlier in March 2024 I wrote about your personalized 'Network Development Plan' as a comparable analogy to 'Gross Domestic Product'. This is what it looked like definitionally

NDP = C + R + I + (X - A) where

-   NDP => Network Development Plan

-   C => Content (Largely the Accomplishments)

-   R => Relationships (People in your Life)

-   I => Investments (Intellectual Growth & Support)

-   X => X Factor (Accelerators)

-   A => Abscondment (De-Accelerators)

Now the labels.

First 90 Days

**Nov 18, 2024**

**\
'Internal' Neuralink: Connecting with your mind**

Neuralink, an Elon Musk company, is building a brain-computer interface
that can bypass damaged neural pathways and facilitate direct
communication between the brain and external devices.

I came across two really great talks and picked a third from my past
life to connect a few dots. What if there was a linkage mechanism like
Neuralink that can super-accelerate your connection and engagement with
the external world. I am sure that there are thousands of such talks,
however my intention at this point is just to provoke thoughts in order
to achieve this acceleration.

# [**[1. Your body language may shape who you are (24 Minutes)]{.underline}**](https://www.ted.com/talks/amy_cuddy_your_body_language_may_shape_who_you_are?subtitle=en) 

Amy in this talk mentions \"power posing,\" where adopting expansive,
confident postures for two minutes can boost feelings of power and
reduce stress. It raises your testosterone and reduces your cortisol.
You fake and infuse confidence in your posing and thinking not just to
make it but to become it. This authentic change will foster personal
growth and empowerment. This internal wiring and preparedness can then
leverage your body posture and expressions to further make seamless
engagement with the external world. How?

[**[2. You are (or can be)
Contagious]{.underline}**](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=cef35Fk7YD8)
When you meet a person first, what do you look at? Face, Shoes or Body.
Not quite, they look at your hands first. Your hands speak a lot - a
hawk, a defender or someone who welcomes. Now I figured what it meant to
welcome with open arms. They look at whether you are holding a rock,
scissor or welcome/warmth. If you can't see someone's hands you can't
see her intentions. Greatest of the Ted speakers use 465 hand gestures
in 18 minutes. Your brain gives 12.5x weightage to other people\'s hand
gestures. Our implied and expressed emotions, fears and intentions are
contagious. When you smile artificially with just your mouth open and
naturally with your mouth open stretching your cheeks all the way to
your eyes, you look more welcoming. Try it. Lastly when you speak what
matters is the deep rooted tone of your intentions. All in all to
accelerate your messaging to the outside world, from the thoughts so
far, your power posing matters and then you exponentiate that with your
niceness. The magic continues.

# [**[3. The Problem With Being "Too Nice"]{.underline}**](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=HrCbXNRP7eg&t=76s) 

Now when people speak, you can know easily when people are being nice
artificially or naturally. When someone speaks about your shoes or your
attire, you can most always tell how much of that is natural or
artificial. What does one want to hear?

The spoken feedback loop is also a very difficult layer to lay over your
posture and expressive niceness. Imagine an interpersonal dance when we
give and receive feedback. Tough feedback without honesty and nicety
creates discomfort in the recipient's body language. Shrunk body or
pulled back chair. It is a lot easier to give general feedback: You did
great, keep doing what you are doing, I love your sense of humor and a
lot more while actually not giving honest feedback. Imagine, someone at
your work tells you to take more initiative. Whatever that means - lord
save me at that point.

Try to be honest and tough at first. Start with the positive part of the
content (you did great, the topic was awesome, your confidence was very
high), move to the net neutral aspects next (you could have changed the
order, used a different font or a more impactful set of words) and
finally lean into the constructive part. Recommend replacement
behaviors: You talked about a great topic although you could have
provided a course of action. They did not walk away with the
understanding that you had intended to convey.... I am sure there is
more.

**Take away from here:** You see that the whole process of impactfully
engaging with the external world is and can be very cyclical. Your inner
wiring, your body language, your warmth, your message and the construct
of it. The feedback loop too. I am amazed at how we exist. Take feedback
from people you work with and find out if they see you as a package or
if you see a package somewhere in someone.

As always, do write back and share your feedback. Let me know what else
I can think about.

**Nov 11, 2024**

Somehow magically, the last few weeks have been focused on thought
leadership and following my thoughts on 'Schmoozing', I got 20% of
readers writing back to me with their perspectives.

Two more perspectives on that note for today: A reader asked me to write
about Competing vs. Collaborating. Separately and secondly, I met a
bunch of highly accomplished families in California who were discussing
their thoughts behind education and making investments for the next
generation. Perhaps there is a convergence on both the topics at the
tail of my message today.

**Competitive vs. Collaborative Colleagues**

We often get impacted by competitive colleagues. Aggressive competitive
mindset can be demonstrated by a combination of schmoozing, blowing your
trumpet, 'I did this' stories, undermining others' ideas, withholding
information, dominating conversations and exaggerating mistakes of
others. Largely extroverted and bombastic behaviors.

On the other hand, individuals who are collaborators and wanting to work
with others will have the 'we did it' mindset, recognize efforts as a
team, allow people to speak, help others to prepare and cover up for
others' mistakes.

**Investing for the Next Generation**

We often worry about rising costs of academia irrespective of whether
you have young children, 'ready to attend college' children or for some
of you who are trying to get additional specialized education. One of
the colleagues at the dinner also mentioned that we need to prepare for
the cost of weddings of our children and perhaps even a down payment for
their new home. I was flabbergasted.

Often as a parent or for self, we will aim to stretch and spend
handsomely on education. Many of the undergrad programs in the United
States cost \$400,000 over 4 years. You have seen similar costs in your
geography or for your programs. Given that financial abilities vary, I
would suggest to not stretch beyond your means to educate yourself or
your dependents and to not make them dependent on your financial
position for a fancy wedding or a house payment.

In all situations competence is what matters. These individuals that
shared commitments for education, marriage or properties all had
converged to technology, of course we are in the Silicon Valley for this
instance. They came from diverse backgrounds like being a nutritionist,
aerospace engineer or an MBA.

Formal education certainly provides the baseline. Navigation in the real
world, unknown to many of us, is purely through building competence.

**Competence: Superseding 'Formal' Academia or Competitive vs.
Collaborative Mindset**

Competence is largely built as a function of cognizance (awareness) and
perseverance. Here is a checklist

-   Identify the problems and opportunities that exist

-   You identify the most challenging initiatives that bring you outside
    > of your comfort zone

-   Learn and develop skills to solve these difficult problems

-   Look for cost effective relevant and alternate training mechanisms
    > to develop skills in adjacency. Basic formal education is required
    > that should not create a long term debt

-   Stay ahead with industry insights

-   Be an effective listener and make decisive contributions

-   Voice assertive opinions with facts

-   Outpace deadlines and targets. Seek help from influential team
    > members to collaborate

-   Be open to receiving and providing constructive criticism

-   Communicate accomplishments with facts and celebrate often

Obviously there is more to this list, so I am always looking forward to
hearing your thoughts and ideas.

**Nov 4, 2024**

**How to be a Schmoozer?**

Let's define a 'Schmoozer' first: This is a person who is a sweet talker
and can very easily persuade others to do what she wants. This skill is
especially important to manage your food chain.

I was with some friends and like how we talk about teaching life skills
at schools and colleges, a colleague of mine, of course with great
intentions, suggested that one thing that people need to be taught is to
be a good 'schmoozer'. I immediately responded and reacted to say, this
is not required. I do not support schmoozing or 'kissing up', crudely
speaking.

**Let the Truth prevail**

In the long run schmoozing can get you somewhere and may also give you
all the wealth and success. You need to ask the question to know what
matters to you. I often speak about authentic communication that
involves honesty, openness and objectivity, applicable at all levels.
Whether you are speaking with your team, your peers or your leadership,
authenticity matters.

When you are dealing with a dilemma of communicating via 'schmooze' or
'truth', especially with people who hold greater influence, ensure you
take care of a few things. Firstly know the path of communicating the
facts, know the choices and the impact or outcomes from each of the
choices. Also, it is important to find the right setup and place to
communicate, ideal 1:1, so that you have minimized the points of
complexity when being courageous when sharing thoughts and ideas.

-   Ensure that you have thoroughly thought about all options and that
    > you are thinking outside the box. Thinking inside the box to
    > schmooze is easy

-   Ensure that you have moved from comfort of conformity inside the box
    > to outside the box

-   You will risk your reputation outside the box however the long term
    > rewards are far superior

-   Discomforted mental state in these situations is very normal

-   To be divergent you will need to cross the border of your mind. This
    > needs long thinking which is different from fast, deep or
    > brilliant thinking. What does this mean? It necessitates
    > exploration of options and the attached value of each of the
    > options

Imagine you are innovating for your organization. You need many inputs
from multiple entities inside and outside your organization, you reach
out to people who have the strong ability to express and then create a
platform for these disparate inputs to converge.

In a nutshell, you know if you are a schmoozer or an impact leader. If
you believe that you are selective or balanced about being both then
think hard. Of course, communication requires safety for both the sender
and the recipient of the information. What are your experiences and
thoughts? Happy to hear back.
