**Oct 20, 2024**

Past week has been eventful in two ways. One was for me to think about
who we really are and second was to appreciate SapceX returning a
booster back at the launch pad from the Starship rocket on Sunday. The
launch tower which was dubbed as chopsticks caught the descending
232-foot stainless steel booster which would be as tall as a 15-storeyed
building.

**Why does this matter?**

The reason it matters is because imagine the acceleration this will
provide to significantly reduce the cost of shipping rockets which is a
measure of cost per kilogram of rocketship.

-   When it all started the returning rockets or components came back as
    > debris so there was no reusability ever

-   Earlier SpaceX launches in the last few years led to successful
    > recovery however not at the base, that means there was a lot of
    > cost of moving these heavy objects at the base for repurposing

-   The cost of launching spaceships and satellites have come down from
    > \$10,000 to \$1,000 per kilogram

-   Missions to Mars can only be accomplished if the cost can be brought
    > down significantly more. Imagine colonization will require sending
    > so much more in the form of constructing a colony wherever in the
    > outer space

**Importance of Focus**

Mars missions will not be accomplished without the 'focus' and for that
you need to know both: what your equivalent Mars colonization mission is
and how focused are you in accomplishing your mission. Let's go back to
the first of the two things I mentioned and think about who we really
are? We often tend to sway our objectives for our greed as humans for
certain designation or a certain remuneration. In the process we lose
sight of the core objectives so some thoughts on that note:

-   Being artificial and adjusting to suit a culture, organization or a
    > leader will often set you up for a failure

-   When working for an organization between where you start and to when
    > you eventually become successful is a long stretched messy middle.
    > The messy middle can make you impatient and uncomfortable

-   Being comfortable with this discomfort will be a big key for your
    > success. It takes many years for the organizations/teams to
    > appreciate what you bring to the table

-   While dealing with the discomfort you will have to build long
    > lasting relationships and identify sponsors/mentors that will help
    > you navigate

-   For your mission, how you utilize your time will help you get to
    > Mars sooner. You will find cross-roads to decide whether you will
    > do something or delegate a given task. If you are not a leader and
    > cannot delegate then you will need colleagues to assist you. You
    > will need to decide which tasks/events will you be a part of or
    > skip the ones that are not part of your mission. Delegation and
    > Assistance should only be facilitated with ones who have the
    > chemistry and relevance to the given tasks/events. We have seen
    > many figureheads who are just out there so be very careful to not
    > become one or spend your cycles with figureheads who don't add
    > value

-   Sometimes we get stuck with the finite nature of outcomes. For
    > example one might address the goal to get a specific share in a
    > specific market. True winners build opportunities and measures
    > with Blue Ocean strategies. A Blue Ocean Strategy is a business
    > approach that focuses on creating new, uncontested market spaces
    > or goals (\"blue oceans\") rather than competing in overcrowded,
    > existing markets (\"red oceans\"). It emphasizes innovation, value
    > creation, and differentiation to make competition irrelevant

**So then let's look at some thought provocations:**

Are you an outlier? Are your objectives or goals when accomplished will
make you one? Do you know your goals and are they going to make you an
outlier?

**Oct 13, 2024**

**Moglis of The AI Jungle**

Following my writeup last week, I had the opportunity to spend a lot
more time understanding the AI landscape. Some more findings with the
hope that I will keep it simple for quite a few of my non-tech
subscribers to appreciate the depth here.

Most, if not all, of you have used OpenAI/ChatGPT for something or the
other. OpenAI released quite a few models of its own assuming that each
increment captured more knowledge of the world and a greater ability to
provide information to its consumers. Assuming that OpenAI would have
published half a dozen of their models, HuggingFace which is a
repository for models published surpassed a count of Million models in
the month of September.

Similar to language models like OpenAI's language models there are
models to interpret/generate texts, images, voice and other aspects.
Majority of these are open source and free to use however there is still
a way for them to generate revenues through the use of compute resources
by consumers and through other partnerships.

Alongside the jungle of models, I saw many coding co-pilots evolve.

**What are Coding Co-pilots?**

In the Airlines business, between being a pilot and the point where we
get to complete auto-pilot operations, Co-Pilots are assistants to the
pilots, which we have seen on the airplanes.

Let's assume that a programmer or a coder is a pilot in this case and
the AI models/software work as co-pilots to increase the assurance of
coder/programmer's (pilot) capabilities. Existing companies like Github
and Microsoft/OpenAI have their co-pilots namely Github co-pliot and
Codex from Microsoft. Figma, a design company which helped imagine
state-of-the-art User Interfaces, is also building capabilities to
convert design templates into ready to use code in a programming
language of your choice.

A bunch of startups, many with very young co-founders have started
companies like Cursor, Codeium, QoDo (Codium earlier), Poolside, and
Augment have built similar co-pilots. They are early stage private
companies and have raised anywhere from \$120M to \$600M. This market
has many players now and will reach a point of saturation between the
speed at which they are evolving and the rate at which existing and new
companies are also adding these kinds of capabilities.

So what do these companies do

-   If you have used (or heard of) VS Code Editor then consider these
    > are forks of VS Code

-   Coding co-pilots are like really nice autocompletion coding
    > capabilities on steroids

-   They unify developer communities within an organization

-   Many of these companies actually use their own co-pilots to further
    > mature their co-pilot capabilities

-   They look over your shoulder as a programmer and are a really great
    > virtual colleague to have

-   Co-pilot models can validate and help code multiple sections of
    > multiple files at the same time

-   They can provide AI aided code reviews and unlike manual reviews of
    > code where we reviewed codes chronologically these editors review
    > codes logically, keeping in mind the flow of the algorithms

**What are the challenges and opportunities?**

A big challenge exists from the point that input prompts which usually
are large programming files and the outputs are small sets of
recommendations making the models respond with a very low latency (or
high speed). This makes them very responsive however expensive as the
size of input tokens into the models need a lot more computation. These
companies that have built co-pilots need to build a lot of caching
ability so that knowledge from previous input prompts can be retained
and effectively managed.

Models usually respond with an edited version of the code recommending
changes that you can remove as codelines from your code (marked in red
usually) and the codelines which you can add (marked in green usually).
To a naked eye of the programmer you can accept or reject these changes
and upon acceptance the changes are automatically made in the code.

I personally experienced the danger that with all the changes, not being
a regular coder, I tended to accept the changes quickly and changed my
code base. Not maintaining a code repository led to a lot of
knowledge/code loss and I realized that while using these you need to be
super attentive and engrossed in your codebase. It was quite frustrating
for me.

The opportunity lies in the fact that these tools can provide better
code review abilities, help maintain version control and also perhaps at
some stage show flowchart/graphical/algorithmic representation of the
recommended changes.

**In a Nutshell**

The space is moving rapidly, getting congested, a lot of investor money
is flowing in and it will be hard to keep up. Naturally, like many other
phenomena there will be consolidation opportunities through success,
mergers and gentle fading away of the few companies.

Are you aware of the space? Did I miss anything that you can share? Are
you using the co-pilots? Are they making you efficient and smarter or
may be efficient and dumber? I am enjoying keeping myself up-to-date.

Let me know if I should write about any other topic of your interest.

**Oct 6, 2024**

Back to AI thoughts after a certain gap. Uber and other equivalent
platforms replaced traditional taxi companies, AirBnB displaced the
hospitality businesses, and cloud technologies displaced traditional
hardware (Compute, Network & Storage) businesses. We are facing yet
another displacement of technology platforms with the advent of AI,
especially with the Language Models.

Many hundreds of millions have already accessed LLMs around the planet
and close to a billion users have directly or indirectly benefited from
them.

It started with GPTs used for inferencing, for writing emails, leading
to a series of co-pilots, langchain agents to today where the world is
moving towards AI agents working under certain orchestration. What does
this mean? Where is it going? How will it evolve? Let's examine some
predictions while asking more questions.

**Generative AI Investments and Expectations**

Companies continue investing in their Generative AI journeys. Although a
great opportunity lies ahead, the budgets for GenAI are not specialized
or specific today. From everything that I have seen, GenAI budgets are
created by re-allocation of dollars from Data Analytics, Business
Applications, spends on Productivity Applications, reduction of
Outsourced Services, and shift of Robotic Process Automation and
Marketing budgets to GenAI. GenAI is still seen as generic in the
broader technology approach and as a result it lacks specificity in
defining roadmaps or objectives. Similarly organizations are still
unsure about the ROI, both in terms of timing and magnitude of the
returns. In a nutshell, the hype of GenAI has gotten a little ahead of
reality today while I do not dismiss the terrific potential that lies
ahead.

**Evolution of On-Prem and SaaS Applications**

These began with two distinct divisions. One part covered data models
that were either custom designed for a specific solution or a packaged
data model that came with the application, on-prem or SaaS based. Second
part covered the application logic which was built based on certain
expected business process behaviors. Millions of application developers
today are employed to manage these comprehensive business systems. The
application logic got modularized for performance and efficiencies even
to the extent of creating microservices based solution architecture.

Modern Data Stacks from companies like Snowflake, Databricks and
hyperscaler's Data Platforms provide access to the data sourced/ingested
from a variety of business systems. Traditional data analytics and
insights were drawn using visualization and analytics engines sitting on
top of these platforms.

**Language models are changing the traditional game here. Let's examine
how?**

**New-Age and largely 'to be' AI/LLM and Data Stack**

Continuing with the narrative of the Datastack, now imagine a data
harmonization layer that sits above the data stack from providers like
Snowflake.

1.  At the bottom most layer of this stack, imagine your Data & AI
    > fabric with LLMs built and integrated into the datasets. LLMs can
    > be self sourced, open sourced models that are customized or closed
    > sourced models accessed using the APIs. Heart and soul with cross
    > company data exists in this datastack layer

2.  Imagine the next layer of specialized Small Language Models which
    > are derivatives of Large Language Models and provide a continuous
    > feedback learning loop back into the LLMs. These models interact
    > with each other, create knowledge graphs and report back causal
    > (Cause and Effect) outcomes to the underlying LLMs

3.  Lastly, imagine a multi-agent network sitting on top of these
    > language models along with a master orchestrator

Let me give an example here. Customer interacts with say Customer
Support AI agent for a service request. This Customer Support AI agent
works with the master orchestrator to interact with Order Management or
Supply Chain AI agents to provide a specific service to the end
customer. Organization's data is managed with LLMs, SLMs provide
specialized function specific learning based on specialized training,
while continuously learning from interactions.

**What will change? When will it change? Will it?**

-   AI Agents will potentially replace SaaS/On-Prem application logic
    > and microservices such that the logic moves to AI agents
    > leveraging specialized Small Language Models

-   Learning and improvements of SLMs/LLMs will happen through data and
    > behaviors, just like a human being would

-   Agents will have complication from the fact that SaaS companies, LLM
    > providers and Data stack companies are going to introduce their
    > version of agents

-   Application logic will move from SaaS to the AI agents that are
    > working with each other

-   LLMs, SLMs, knowledge graphs and causal models will have to play
    > together such that they replace pre-programmed deterministic SaaS
    > behaviors with model behaviors

-   Will this displace SaaS companies? Will SaaS companies be
    > duplicative with both, the application logic and AI agents

-   Will we move from high maintenance white box programmed SaaS logic
    > to model based self-learning with a potential non-deterministic
    > mindset

-   Will there be deterrents to slow this growth? Many companies that I
    > have worked with do not even enable co-pilots owing to security
    > risks

I personally feel, following my earlier prediction of SaaS, AI and
Business processes to be in a single melting pot, that SaaS is due for
some displacement. Although, when and how is for the time to tell. What
do you think?

**Sep 29, 2024**

Firstly, my sincere apology for the miss last weekend. I came from
Mumbai late Sunday evening last week and for the 24 hours following 7
days up until right now, I went through a long dengue outage. Never been
through a phase like this which I may write about in the near future.
Here are the thoughts for today in the meantime.

During the India-Bangladesh first cricket test match, one of the
commentators mentioned how the Indian cricket team must have been on a
high after the world cup win to come and play this series now. I am like
did we not lose the world cup, what is he talking about? I had the
pleasure of seeing a few matches of the ODI world cup and a strong
recollection of our loss to Australia in the finals.

Let me ask another question here. Do you know who Liz Truss is? Most of
you may not - Liz Truss served as the Prime Minister of the United
Kingdom for just 49 days, making her the shortest-serving PM in British
history. Liz Truss\'s brief tenure was characterized by a failed
economic experiment, market instability, and a rapid loss of political
authority and support. The speed at which these events unfolded left her
unable to recover or effectively govern, leading to her short-lived term
as Prime Minister. This happened in the month of October '22.

**So, what? Why do these events matter?**

Very early in my career I was made aware of one thing. You are as good
as your worst number or your weakest link. For me India's loss of ODI
world cup finals resonated much easier than the relatively recent T20
world cup victory. Nobody remembered all the great work Liz Truss would
have done to become the Prime Minister of the United Kingdom. She could
barely make it to 49 days in her job before her nation became
unforgiving. They did not let her survive on the account of the grave
misses.

Earlier in June I wrote about this Salesforce.com mishap. For having
reported revenue lower by an absolute number just equating to less than
0.5% of the forecast revenue, Salesforce.com dropped its valuation by a
whopping \$40B (20%) in just one day.

Assuming the loss in a sporting event is not an error, misses in
revenue, project's deadline, political blunders or product security
lapses can be of grave danger to the brands of both, individuals and
organizations. A response process needs to be imbibed in the culture of
the organization or the fabric of an individual.

Of course now, '\"To err is human; to forgive, divine.\" Professional
world certainly does not experience as much divinity for forgiveness. So
let's intervene and ask some questions.

**Do I/We Err and if so What do I/We do?**

In the information age, news and words travel at rocket speed. So when
you err, here is what one must do:

When errors happen, good leaders treat errors as opportunities for
learning and organizational improvement, sharing lessons with their
teams to foster a culture of growth. They

-   Communicate transparently and promptly

-   Assess the impact and prioritize mitigation

-   Implement a robust fix and learn from the incident

-   Hold people accountable while fostering a no-blame culture.

-   Rebuild trust through consistent actions

-   Show empathy and offer support

**Asking yourself:**

Do you recall a time when you made a blunder? Did you find someone else
to point a finger at or could take charge of what transpired? Do you
recall such a situation that happened around you and how a given leader
played her part?

Is your organization or you as an individual prepared for unforeseen
times? Do you have a plan or even a mindset to respond with calm?

Sep 15, 2024

Have you ever thought of how inflation is measured? Of course, in a way
it is a measure of affordability of goods and services. I was curious so
I asked who measures, what it measures and how?

Inflation is measured using Consumer Price Index (CPI) and the Producer
Price Index (PPI) as a measure to know the rise or fall in the price of
goods and services over time. This measure will play a key role in soon
to be announced interest rate adjustments in the United States by the
Federal Reserve Bank.

It is a measure of affordability for housing, food, transportation,
healthcare and education. Federal Agents (Humans) measure the costs of
these items in 75 urban areas for what the consumers actually pay after
adjusting for discounts and promotions. The percentage change from the
base price is determined as increase/decrease in the current price
determining if the movement is inflationary (costs increase) or
deflationary (costs decrease). Similarly, PPI is tracked by interacting
with producers for what are the trends in the selling price of housing,
transportation, food, healthcare and education.

Two questions then come to mind. In the age of AI and LLMs why do we
need humans to measure this and what other indexes do exist and how they
are measured. Here are the few notable ones.

Volatility Index: This is a forward-looking index that reflects market
participants\' expectations of volatility over the next 30 days. The
more investors expect significant price swings in the near future, the
higher the volatility index will be. In simple terms, it's a barometer
of the market\'s anxiety level. It measures the 'fear factor' from the
real financial data and is far more automated than the CPI/Inflation
measure with human involvement.

Global Temperature and Climate Indices track the planet's health. They
are far more accurate and tracked over a long period, even in the
century years.

Arctic Sea Ice Extent Index tracks the changes in the size of the Arctic
ice cap, which is a crucial indicator of global warming.

The Air Quality Index (AQI) which is observed on a daily basis even by
common (wo)man is critical for understanding the health impacts of air
pollution in cities worldwide. The AQI is calculated based on
measurements of pollutants such as particulate matter (PM2.5, PM10),
ozone (O3), nitrogen dioxide (NO2), sulfur dioxide (SO2), and carbon
monoxide (CO).

Of course, we are all aware of indexes like NASDAQ, DJIA (in the US) and
SENSEX (BSE in India) as a measure of stock market's performance.

While most of these indices are \*\*highly accurate\*\*, they can still
face challenges related to data collection in less-developed or remote
areas, timeliness, and the complexity of the phenomena they measure
(e.g., biodiversity or water stress).

So, What is in it for me? Now imagine a 'Personal Index' that would
measure you by you. What if you were to measure yourself? What would the
performance basis be - would it be others around you or just you in
comparison how much better you are this year compared to what you were
last year?

I imagine life similar to a game of golf - how better is your current
game to the past game as I just compete with myself to be a better me. I
would rather be a racehorse with blinders on the sides to not be
distracted by the world around me.

Do you know of other critical indexes that I may have missed? Do you
think of other imaginary indexes that can exist? Are you a racehorse or
a fiercely competitive individual that always looks around?

title: US China Tech Competition Defines Era
content:
**

I was on a trip to Rajasthan last week, and after a very long time, I
went away without my computer, so I missed writing last week.

Watching the India-Australia cricket match preview today, I came across
an important message, 'Play the ball and not the man', in context with
how you need not worry about the larger perceived beast that might not
even exist and focus on what is in your control. Today's thoughts are a
trigger of this basic understanding.

**Tug of War between Approach and Outcomes**

Imagine a project where you have invested a fair, if not significant,
amount of time and resources. It could be about learning a comprehensive
skill like becoming a financial advisor, working for a cause like a
not-for-profit initiative to provide education for underprivileged
society or building your own business or a company.

With most of these, you would have explicit or implicit end goals in
mind: It can be about outcomes like revenue, profits, sales, a new job,
promotion, number of lives enriched or number of trees planted. It can
be anything. For the sake of simplicity, let's call these **outputs**.

To achieve your goals, you need resources in any combination of funds,
skills, processes, people and institutions. You leverage these resources
and navigate through circumstances that involve bureaucracy, chemistry
and other real-life challenges. For the sake of simplicity, let's call
these as **inputs**.

Time goes by and you reach a point where you have made progress with
your stated goals or **outputs**. Through the process, you may realize
some surprising findings about your environment: your **inputs** in
terms of your beliefs or values are conflicted. You are on the course to
achieve your goals (outputs) and there are fundamental questions that
remain unanswered about the methodology employed. Possibly to be even
more clearer that the methodology employed is not aligned with how you
think.

With **inputs**, methodology or the process employed, there are three
possibilities:

1.  In an ideal world, with a fairy tale perspective, methodologies are
    > perfect (inputs) and they are in turn yielding desirable outcomes
    > (outputs)

2.  Many a times, you may realize that outputs are not yielded as the
    > methodologies for inputs are compromised. Easy to fix - press
    > Reset here

3.  Often you get the stated results however the methodology employed is
    > somewhat or significantly compromised

In scenarios 2 & 3 above you have some decisions to make. Obviously, in
scenario #2 above, you need to realize quickly and decide if you need to
fail fast. In a situation like #3 above, you need a deeper examination.
What does that look like?

**Fail Fast or Deliberate**

This is a game of your conscience: Milk the cow (proverbially) or Fix
the game

-   If your fundamental beliefs are compromised then it is a lot easier
    > to fail than to deliberate

-   If there is an opportunity to navigate and fix the methodology and
    > the associated process assuming you want to capitalize on the
    > progress and fix the methodology then certainly stay the course

    a.  Confront with the reality and have honest conversations with
        > people involved

    b.  Identify all the red tapes that exist, talk openly with involved
        > constituencies and people

    c.  Make time-bound recommendations and a very effective tracking
        > mechanism

-   Prolonged situations in scenario #3 can have deep impacts on your
    > personal (mental and physical well-being)

    a.  Silent and looking 'composed' individuals can have serious
        > personal impacts

    b.  Individuals with outbursts to confront loudly may benefit from
        > being expressive. This can cause certain immediate short-term
        > impacts on others involved however you are better off with
        > this quick failure than a dreaded deliberation

A big example of significant changes was experienced with major shifts
in Meta's (Facebook) strategies:

-   They decommissioned their biggest crypto initiative named 'Libra' in
    > early 2022

-   They right-sized (headcount reduction) their organization and
    > significantly changed their AR investment strategies in early 2023

-   They invested efficiently in Open Source AI framework by building a
    > series of LLM (Llama series) models for their business'
    > forward-looking strategy

-   Enviably, their share is valued at 6x from where it bottomed below
    > \$100 not too long ago

As Meta would have faced the ball and not the man behind in the
cricketing analogy, have you come across such situations? Is there a
monster behind your goals that intimidates you in terms of the man with
the ball as opposed to the ball itself? What if the monster is the one
that pays your bills and more? What would you do?

title: Europe Seeks Strategic Autonomy From America
content:
When you look back at life, you can think of major milestones and
setbacks. Rights and Wrongs. Perhaps there is a method to repeating the
rights: Look Back, Introspect, Improvise, Rinse and Repeat.

Satya Nadella, in this conversation, looked back to identify things that
worked for Microsoft. It is a long list: starting from Windows 3.1,
Windows NT, Internet Explorer, Dynamics, Gaming, Office 365, Azure,
LinkedIn, and now their AI journey with the investment in OpenAI. There
were some bumps on the way, like mobile (remember Nokia), search, Skype,
and their attempts to play in the larger SaaS and Cybersecurity
business.

**Failing at something is perfectly alright**

Last week I touched upon 'Failing Fast' and this time around with
Satya's narrative and a few other bits, here is an attempt for a broader
correlation.

-   Failure of Microsoft Search or Skype is an indication of
    > differenting between not doing something compared to failing at
    > doing something. There are more things Microsoft was successful
    > from doing compared to the failure from doing thing

-   When Microsoft started the Azure (Cloud) journey, AWS was already
    > ahead of the game. Similarly, Google had a lot of advancements in
    > Deepmind and Microsoft could still capitalize on their AI game
    > through their investment in OpenAI. These are never one-player
    > games whether it is AWS vs. Azure, Gemini vs. OpenAi or Databricks
    > vs. Snowflake

-   Having lost their ability to capitalize from their leadership with
    > PCs and Windows to a shift in cloud computing wasn't bad. If you
    > keep playing, you can win it all again and they did with Azure
    > over time

-   In another example when Apple had to design the Macintosh
    > improvements they were competing with a \$30B IBM giant compared
    > to their about a \$1B business value. As Steve Jobs
    > [[said]{.underline}](https://youtu.be/s4Cz49MLh4o?si=dclvig6qgUWECFrc),
    > when companies grow bigger they want to replicate success by
    > repeating the institutionalized processes or frameworks. Process
    > wrongly becomes a strategic driver. In reality, your best people
    > and the teams are the ones who understand the content for
    > innovation far more than the process itself. These high achievers
    > may be a pain in the back to manage however their content and
    > creations can be second to none

-   Of course, there are companies like Amazon who have a fascinating
    > process of no PowerPoint slides and they have their 'infamous
    > notes readout' mechanism prior to meetings. These powerful
    > processes do exist, however, they are deemed to be useless without
    > outstanding content created by top talent

When the world speaks about Microsoft, they speak of Satya equally as
much as they would have of Bill Gates. Imagine someone like Satya who is
a consummate insider promoted to the CEO of the company and then getting
the company to be the most valued business (\$3T+) in the history of
time. At one point, Satya's wife presented to him a book titled [[Growth
Mindset]{.underline}](https://youtu.be/W9DV2K4Aebw?si=8AEInIDROVm5iSC_)
(Carol Dweck) and this mindset is instituted in every aspect of
Microsoft's growth over the last decade and more.

In a nutshell, to always keep doing something is imperative, failure is
part of the process, and the process itself cannot determine success.

-   Right people on the job,

-   the right content/creation from them,

-   the growth mindset and

-   their relentless perseverance will get you to win, always

Do you have a growth mindset, do you have a high degree of perseverance
and are you in the right job without the overheads of process or
expectations complexity? What a great time of the year to ponder these
questions...

Happy holidays.

title: Middle East Transforms Beyond Oil Dependency
content:
As we end the year, let\'s think about Agents (AI) and Agency (Human).
Most of the AI based approaches are to mimic and exemplify human
behaviors in machines. Conversely, for this time, let's personify this
'Agentic Mindset' inside a Human Being.

**A Recap: AI Agents**

Earlier in October (Oct 6), I wrote about AI agents.

Specialized AI agents are typically Small Language Models which are
derivatives of Large Language Models and provide a continuous feedback
learning loop back into the LLMs. These models interact with each other,
create knowledge graphs and report back causal (Cause and Effect)
outcomes to the underlying LLMs. Specialized agents offer artificial
intelligence in a specific scenario.

In simple words, compared to a Large Language Model like ChatGPT
responding to any kind of questions a specialized model is trained for a
specific purpose like writing SQL statements or in simpler terms a
fitness tracking app using TinyGPT will suggest workout routines based
on user history and goals.

Just remember that in the Agentic AI architecture, orchestrating layer
can invoke calls to multiple specialized agents.

**High Agency Mindset Orchestration**

High agency mind (of a human) is trained to take full control of her
actions and destiny and not wait for perfect conditions or blame the
external environment. If you were a 'high agency' individual, your
orchestration layer would be a very determined mindset that will always
avoid hallucination. You will invoke a variety of agents in your
personal space to persuade, to navigate, to not be distracted and to
constantly be a mechanic of reinforced learning through any kind (human
or machine) feedback. Your mind here is strengthened to activate variety
of personal agents

-   One set of agents will keep your focus on pursuing goals with
    > determination. This agent conceives ideas and turns them into
    > concrete actions

-   An agent in you will take responsibility of your life and focus on
    > what you can control

-   An agent that will evaluate situations based on your knowledge
    > repository and wisdom more than accepting external opinions

-   Another agent to push through challenges: this one will especially
    > look for how other individuals that do not have high agency are
    > not distracting you. Distractions can come from external agencies,
    > largely humans, who can be a combination of nay sayers or are
    > conservative thinkers in nature

As a high-agility individual, you are always on your 'treadmill',
energizing others, seeking growth, and not giving up on constraints.

This is a great time of the year to reflect on your grit. Ask yourself:
Am I trained to stay focused? Do I realize when distractions slow me
down? Do I find an excuse or blame in the outside world? Are my goals
big enough?

title: Africa Emerges as Next Growth Frontier
content:
**

As we kick into the new year, I wonder how we define some James
Bond-like experiences and how we achieve them. Two thoughts on that
note: A corollary between new-age AI-enabled smart devices and
communicating effectively.

**For Your 'Ears' Only:** If there was a James Bond movie starring
currently available smart devices then it would certainly be titled as
'For Your Ears Only', just for the fact that they always have their ears
ON. You have already experienced how you are talking about something
with your friends or family and the next thing you see is a promotional
advertisement of products related to your conversations on your social
and professional media feeds.

As soon as Artificial General Intelligence (AGI) or Artificial Super
Intelligence (ASI) will kick in, you will see an AGI/ASI starrer
representation of Matrix (Keanu Reeves Sci-Fi from 1999).

This eavesdropping of AI in our lives made me think about what it means
to keep our ears open as a human or do we behave like Mahatma Gandhi's
three monkeys: See No Evil, Hear No Evil and Speak No Evil.
Unfortunately, modern-day organizations are not wired to sustain this
thought.

Let's devise how one can behave in an organizational setup.

**Redefining 'See No Evil, Hear No Evil, Speak No Evil':** To do the
best in your profession you need to keep your ears open. This to me is
not about eavesdropping but to build a super cognitive spatial
awareness. If you see something or hear something that needs attention
then be very critically aware of what transpires. After all, modern-day
organizations (for profit or otherwise) are designed to drive certain
outcomes and we often hear the other corporate jargon: If you see
something then say something. Here is a quick look at what modern-day
organizational monkeys would look like (courtesy DALL.lE openAI) and
this was the prompt: 'Can you create a visual representation that shows
Gandhi's 3 monkeys with a slight modification that shows one monkey with
hear no evil selectively listening with one ear open, second one with
appreciating the evil with one eye open and the third one speaking
wisely... perhaps sitting in a corporate setup inside a conference room'

![](media/image15.png){width="6.5in" height="3.7083333333333335in"}

**How does one execute being an effective communicator?**

-   'Seeing/Hearing' things require effective reading of the room.
    > Knowing who is in charge (the authority), knowing participants,
    > body language, responses from yes (wo)men, the silence of the
    > quiet ones, the hollow loudspeakers and authentic participants is
    > important. Scan the room to know participants in all the segments
    > and their (un)intended messages

-   Now that you have some cognition of the players, process the most
    > important stuff, stuff that matters

-   Build an active filter to know who is listening and who is not
    > listening. Who in the authority is around to hear and understand
    > what is going on

-   Once you identify the critical stuff that matters, identify who
    > needs to hear this

-   Know what needs to be told. More importantly, identify the
    > mechanics: How will you tell and When will you tell

**In a nutshell:** Understand the redefined 'organizational' monkeys

-   Keep your eyes and ears open

-   Know what is going on and if you see/hear things that impact our
    > being then certainly do something about it. You will know that
    > something is going on, so don't translate this approach to an
    > equivalent of eavesdropping

-   Be direct in your communication after identifying the message, the
    > people that need to be communicated, the packaging of the message,
    > timing and the location

-   When something matters, certainly do something about it and don't be
    > a silent observer on the sideline

-   Make a dent and think of 10x value disruptions

Do you recall any situations where you personified this modern-day
monkey business? Did it help or backfire? Will you try and become so, if
you did not voice out your part in the past? Do you think differently?

Happy New Year

title: Latin America's Political Shifts Impact Economy
content:
**

**Rome is Burning:** It is estimated that ongoing Los Angeles
(California) fires have caused damages equivalent to \$100B to \$150B in
losses. Today, there is no unmanned surveillance or preventive defense
mechanism in place to detect and prevent these outrages. There are some
companies that provide aerial intelligence to help with the defense
mechanism for the responding agencies however that is not enough.
Significant progress in AI and Quantum Computing is required to defend
the planet from these calamities.

As the progressive changes evolve in the AI space, it will expose us to,
both, the curses and the boons. [[Geoffery
Hinton]{.underline}](https://www.theguardian.com/technology/2024/dec/27/godfather-of-ai-raises-odds-of-the-technology-wiping-out-humanity-over-next-30-years),
the Godfather of AI, quotes that there is a 10% to 20% chance of AI
leading to human extinction in three decades. Well the outlook is fairly
positive with that low probability, however there is a possibility of
extinction as well from the low probability. To the best of my
understanding, the impact will not be probabilistic, but of some
proportionate representation of change in our lives. In a way Hinton
actually increased the chances from 10 to 10-20% range and in response
he stated that we have never had to deal with things (AI) more
intelligent than ourselves before. The only thing that came close was an
example of an infant baby that controlled her mother, who is the more
intelligent of the two.

**What it takes to prevent Rome from burning:** What does it then take
to positively engage with this fast changing world and what do you focus
on? Two weeks back I brought up this 'high agency' mindset and here are
some thoughts that purely focus on the input process and value focus on
the quality of work done as opposed to the quantitative outcomes.

**The Process Outlook**

-   While not demeaning '(y)our' formal education, you will not learn
    > anything deeply in your basic undergrad programs. Of course, if
    > you are doing deep and narrow vertical research as part of a
    > doctorate program then it is a completely different story. No
    > matter what each of us studied, to use and apply AI for example in
    > our professional life, we will need to go back to some AI
    > training.

-   Our learning and knowledge application process needs to be
    > continuous. This involves broad reading, researching, continuous
    > hunger for information, talking to really smart people and the
    > ability to connect information from unrelated fields.

-   Critical thinking and Problem solving mindsets are far more
    > important skills. Now imagine that as part of your work
    > assignment, you have a unique problem, unrelated to your academic
    > knowledge, to solve. For example, when you went to college a
    > decade ago at a Marketing school and you were building a social
    > media campaign when a lot of the influencer based techniques were
    > not documented. Obviously, you will need to acquire knowledge and
    > skills to understand platform-specific algorithms, content
    > creation for different social media formats, and build
    > relationships with influencers.

-   You need to leverage the tools, leverage a lot of easily accessible
    > doctorate-like online research and work with a high agency
    > mindset. Don't use one off answers from these tools but build
    > skills to master a given topic with a lot of foundational details
    > and then apply the tools of learning. It does not mean that you
    > walk into your physician's clinic, and post doing some cursory
    > research on the internet, tell her what is wrong with you.

**Being Obsessed:** In addition to having a great process outlook you
need to obsessed with:

1.  Simplicity for what you build

2.  Apply Design Thinking

3.  Speaking like how your Customer would like to hear from you

4.  Communicating to the world with a Marketing mindset

5.  Giving them an experience, not a product

After all Larry Ellison (Oracle), Bill Gates (Microsoft), Steve Jobs
(Apple), Mark Zuckerberg (Meta) and Elon Musk (X, SpaceX, Tesla,
Neuralink) obsessively built the greatest of the companies focusing on
process outlook. They all also have the commonality of dropping out of
their college programs at some point.

So coming back to the latest controversy on absolute 90 hours a week
effort, do you believe if all of these leaders worked hard? They all did
and they still do - the good thing is nobody told them to. My take away
for that is to remain net neutral of what these 90 hours a week opinions
and pushes are - make your choices, build your process, be obsessed and
do what is right for you.

title: AI Infrastructure Investment Becomes Arms Race
content:
**

December 2024 reported 8 million open jobs compared to 6.4 million
unemployed individuals in the U.S. This has largely been the trend for a
while and that there is still either a lack of desire or lack of skills
for employment. We completed more than 2 years of significant advances
in AI/LLMs, post OpenAI's ChatGPT announcement in Nov '22.

In the early part of the 20th century, tractors were introduced with the
mindset of efficiently feeding the humankind and not to create
disharmony in the agricultural economy. AI has to operate similarly;
else, with all our jobs eliminated, we will have machines working with
the machines and make humans extinct in the process. It is very unlikely
that humans will destroy her race. This necessitates the AI and the
machines to coexist in harmony with humans.

**What has changed in the last 2 years?**

Obviously, the first thing we got access to was a very simple ability to
prompt the models with our questions. Advances in the AI/LLMs
improvised, both, the professionals and the people consuming their
services. Here are some examples:

-   Content Creators and Copywriters: Nowadays, a lot of the blogs and
    > content are seamlessly created with the use of LLMs. Grammarly.com
    > and Writer.com provide powerful AI based writing and editing tools

-   Administrative Tools: AI tools now help to automate email
    > correspondence, meeting scheduling, travel management and data
    > trend identification. Microsoft 365 Copilot is one such provider
    > and Athena Executive Services provide virtual assistants to
    > perform all these tasks

-   Customer Support Representatives: AirBnB has for over years not
    > provided human based customer support and has relied significantly
    > on their knowledge tree. Several AI based technical support
    > frameworks now partially replace the human based support

-   Legal Analysts and Paralegals: Harvey.Ai and Casetext significantly
    > expedite processing and analyzing of legal documents, dramatically
    > lowering the workload on junior staff

**What can additionally change in the next 2 years?**

Financial Analysts, Marketeers, Medical Transcribers, Educators,
Architects, Designers, Software Developers, Radiologists and Recruitment
efforts will go through significant acceleration and improvisation with
the help of AI based frameworks.

**What AI/LLM Opportunities do exist and will evolve?**

Prompt Engineers, Agentic AI Developers, AI Administrators, Synthetic
Data Creators, AI Ethics Managers, AI Policy Writers and users of the
above mentioned and evolving AI frameworks will find new modes of
employment. If you are a professional in a non-AI field, your knowhow
and use of these evolving frameworks will keep you relevant, make you
hyper productive and make you a successful leader in your journeys.

Additionally, AI will also expose us to new age vulnerabilities and will
necessitate more growth in building specialized skills, information
security, and intelligent data management.

**Convergence of AI, Robotics and the Physical World**

We will see this convergence in healthcare to conduct remote and robotic
surgeries, as humanoids in factory setup, autonomous full service
driving, ai-powered robots for companionship, monitoring for the
elderly, in warfare and in securing the physical world from calamities.

**As I wrap this topic,** let's not forget that AI based executive
assistant will support human business leaders, AI based content will be
read by humans, AI in Healthcare will enable physicians and benefit the
humans after all, full service driving or autonomous vehicles will move
humans or goods consumed by humans, humanoids will help produce goods
for the use of humans and care for elder humans (not just machines) and
AI will support customers who are humans.... The real question is what
role do you want to play, which side of the equation do you want to be
on and how would you capitalize these advancements in your being?

**It\'s time for an AI update, once again.** Most of you are familiar
with ChatGPT (OpenAI's Large Language Model) which enables tasks for
text generation, translation and natural language processing based on
the large source of text datasets, which are widely available on the
Internet or otherwise. ChatGPT and other models evolved to become
multi-modal in nature to process modalities of texts, voice, images and
videos to generate output in form of texts, voices and images, largely
speaking.

**Outlook for the year 2025:** I have already mentioned about AI agents
and here is the recap to level set baseline understanding for today's
write-up:

Specialized AI agents are typically Small Language Models, as
derivatives of Large Language Models. They provide a continuous feedback
learning loop back into the LLMs. These models interact with each other,
create knowledge graphs and report back causal (Cause and Effect)
outcomes to the underlying LLMs. Specialized agents offer artificial
intelligence in a specific scenario.

In simple words, compared to a Large Language Model like ChatGPT
responding to any kind of questions a specialized model is trained for a
specific purpose like writing SQL statements or in simpler terms a
fitness tracking app can be created from using TinyGPT, which can
suggest workout routines based on user history and goals.

OpenAI announced the 'O' series (the letter O and not the number 0) of
models starting with O1 and recently released model chatGPT O3. Both
these models respond with well-reasoned explanations. To understand with
an example, for a prompt like "If Sarah is older than Tom, and Tom is
older than Mike, who is the youngest?" ChatGPT O1 will respond after
reasoning to understand that Sarah is older than Tom, Tom is older than
Mike and therefore, the age hierarchy is: Sarah \> Tom \> Mike to
conclude that Mike is the youngest. Comparatively, version O3 provides
deeper and complex reasoning making it more capable, however it becomes
slower due to increased 'think time'.

In addition, OpenAI announced the operator mode which is available for
the advanced users who pay \$200 a month for their subscription.
Operator mode works like a classic human operator to solve complex
problems with AI: for example if you provide a recipe, image of
available ingredients in your refrigerator or pantry then the operator
mode can identify the missing ingredients. It will go and prep your
order for the online grocery provider and wait for you to submit the
order.

The reasoning, operator mode and the agentic AI capabilities will be
greatly leveraged in 2025.

**Chinese Goods have arrived: DeepSeek** is a Chinese AI startup that
has developed advanced language models, notably the DeepSeek-R1, the
opensource AI model that is as powerful as OpenAI's O1. Notably, it was
released within only 2 months of OpenAI's O3 release. They also released
6 additional small scale models ranging from 1.5B to 70B parameters.
Remember that a parameter is a weight assigned as a connection between 2
neurons of a model, which adjusts during the training of the model and
improves predictions. Smaller models provide ease of use, low cost and
better efficiency for well defined problems.

-   Like many classic Chinese goods, cost of million input tokens is
    > only \$0.55 and million output tokens is \$2.19. OpenAI is 7x more
    > expensive in comparison

-   While reasoning DeepSeek-R1 shares the underlying chain of thoughts
    > similar to explanation provided above to determine Mike as the
    > youngest of the 3 people

-   DeepSeek-R1 Model was built cost-effectively as, unlike OpenAI, not
    > much consideration was put on safety and was built with very high
    > IQ Chinese engineers, of course at a much lower cost. Sounds apt
    > for Chinese product

-   Although this low cost model will allow many startups to compete
    > easily in the grander scale

**Announcing Stargate, a \$500B US led AI Initiative:** On another note,
last week, Donald Trump led the announcement of \$500 billion AI
infrastructure project in the United States as Joint venture between
OpenAI, SoftBank, Oracle, and MGX, an Emirati investment firm.

-   \$500B will be spent between now and 2029 with \$100B already
    > committed for deployment in 2025 with the first data center
    > deployment in Abilene, Texas

-   This AI infrastructure aims to enable early cancer detection using
    > AI-powered blood tests, develop personalized cancer vaccines using
    > AI and mRNA

-   It will also support various AI applications across industries
    > including healthcare and national security

-   With this large investment plan, it will create significant entry
    > barriers for desiring bad actors

-   Of course, China and other leading economies will bounce back with
    > their investments and probably even a low cost alternative

This \$500B investment is in addition to

-   Colossus, Musk's 100,000 Nvidia H100 GPUs supercomputer built
    > already to expand to 200,000 GPUs and eventual scale of over 1
    > million GPUs. This was built in Memphis, Tennessee just within 3
    > months as a collaboration between xAI (Musk), Dell, Nvidia and
    > SuperMicro

-   Microsoft, Meta and Amazon plan to invest additional \$80B, \$75B
    > and \$65B respectively in 2025 to expand their AI infrastructure

Power games to win in the AI space have begun. Time to keep our eyes and
ears open

All of us have a family, a trusted circle of friends and a professional
environment. Some of you are leaders or matured practitioners in your
profession, some are aspiring to be the leader tomorrow and some in
early phase of their careers. Let's assume different roles to dig
deeper.

**Circle of Life:** As a parent or as a child, you have experienced
situations where perceivingly one sibling gets a lot of attention and
many of her shortcomings were tolerated. You may have been a sibling who
was benefitted or in a given situation you were impacted by privileges
the other ones received. As a parent, you may have unintentionally
favored one child over the other. Similarly, in a professional setup you
have seen colleagues who have been favorites in an organization and as a
leader you may have favored one bunch over the others, yet again
unintentionally. Friends also share similar behaviours or feelings with
each other.

In all these interactions you are impacted from other people's
behaviors: some demonstrate anger, some share complaints, some become
seemingly or relatively dysfunctional or nonperformant in their jobs.

**The Lion King:** Whether family, friends or professional setup, you
have relationships with other people and their relative (in)abilities to
be expressive. In my professional leadership development workshops, I
spend a lot of time on cognizance (awareness of world around us):
ability to understand the workplace, the environment, the economy, the
culture and most importantly the people at all levels.

A key aspect of cognizance requires extraordinary communication skills.

-   When someone is complaining, whining or showing unruly behavhiors,
    > many a times, they don't say what they really want to say

-   These behaviors can distort you and frustrate you as you don't have
    > time for all this. At the workplace, you just want to finish your
    > day and go back to family. At home, you just want to finish your
    > dinner and get ready for the workday. With friends, you just want
    > to finish drinking your coffee (or other brown liquids) and get
    > back to whatever is next

-   Most always these obvious unruly behaviors or interactions happen
    > because you actually don't hear what they actually mean to say

-   They see you in a position of power, a caregiver, a solution
    > provider or just somebody who needs to lend their ears

Most always, we deal with a very difficult cocktail of minds and we feel
burdened. Why am I holding myself responsible for these people? They are
adult co-workers, friends or family so get your game together guys.
Unfortunately, life does not work like this. As a result be **the king,
the Lion King**:

-   Firstly, enjoy being in the position of power that someone is
    > trusting you to be the confidante

-   Lend them your ears. Try and understand what they actually want to
    > say

-   Don't judge people in a very hard way as it it detrimental to both
    > the parties

-   On January 5th, I wrote about reading the room and similarly today
    > the message is to focus on the other person and try to understand
    > why they came to you

When someone asks for your time irrespective of what the issue is give
it to them right away. Don't setup a meeting to decide when the actual
meeting will happen. I have seen many conversations, that actually only
need 5-10 of hallway or drive-time conversations, take weeks to be
setup. So move at the pace of the progress AI is making and be out
there. Always check-in on people you care about.

spend 2 minutes to watch this video.

I have been coaching a bunch of leaders for the past 2 months. When I
asked them to look back and identify major accomplishments from the past
year, they could easily do so. Although the narratives turned out to be
impressive, they came back with caveats, which may not be uncommon for a
lot of us.

-   Outcomes were not tied to specific pre-written objectives, they just
    > happened

-   There was a mindset of gratification, of course in a good way,
    > largely for the effort based inputs that provided qualitative
    > outcomes. I led, I improved, I implemented, I trained... all good
    > stuff however without a connection to the predetermined objectives

-   Largely individuals expect guidance for what they need to do and may
    > not easily be able to determine the expected measures at the gate.
    > She may have improved something or implemented something from
    > efforts however it does not tie to either to the larger objective
    > or does not quite meaningfully add to the sum total game

-   Most of us need a BHAG (Big Hairy Audacious Goal), a compelling long
    > term intriguing goal that keeps us inspired to keep pushing. Of
    > course, I need someone to tell me what this should be - it is a
    > natural tendency

Either I need someone to tell me what the larger purpose of the
institution or the organization should be or if I am an independent one
person entity then I will keep pushing to do what I do in the best
possible manner without defining this BHAG (Be-HAG).

What do you do if this does not exist in your definition of life? I say
one of 3:

-   Ask for the larger purpose which the institution or the organization
    > is driving towards

-   If you cannot get this purpose clearly from them then recommend for
    > what it should be and use it as a reference to create your purpose
    > for navigation

-   If you are an independent one person entity then create your Be-HAG,
    > something that you think is largely unachievable

Now tie your life relentlessly to achieve this. It does not mean you
don't take the time to drink your poison, smell the roses or have a good
time. Intersperse life and the purpose of it.

As a human being, you can also be slightly multi-purposed. I know of
this ambitious person who wants to ensure that no one sleeps hungry, at
least in her vicinity. She can certainly do so however unless you are
sitting on a gold mine, you are not going to easily be able to feed the
world. In this instance, she can have a professional goal to excel in
her work and generate a lot of wealth. She can incrementally then work
towards the larger goal of feeding the world. She can certainly have 2
BHAGs. This is your life and you have choices to make.

With that said, ask yourself if you know of your BHAG, your
organization's BHAG, are you going to ask for it in absence of one and
create one if you do not gain that clarity. I want to follow up on this
thought to write about how we can remain undeterred with our BHAGs and
stay focused. Next week on that aspect.

As a starter, I heard this somewhere. Define your BHAG and start working
on this, the path will appear. Clarity does not come before action, it
comes from action.

**February 23, 2025 - 96**

My first introduction to a computing processor (CPU) was to an Intel
chip number 8086. A simple program to add two numbers '3' and '5' looked
like this.

-   3E 05; C6 03; 76

-   This was machine language code to say, load number 05 in a register
    > (3E)

-   Add immediately the number 03 to the register (C6)

-   Halt the program (76)

Assembly language was the next improvement to the above machine language
representation, which was primarily a program in terms of hexadecimal
numbers (16 digits in the form of 0 to 9 followed by A to F compared to
decimals ranging only from 0 to 9). The same program was written in
Assembly language with a slight improvement for human understanding:

-   MVI 03, A (Move 3 to A)

-   ADI 05 (Add 05 to A so A = A + 05)

-   HLT (Halt the program)

Programming languages like FORTRAN, C, C++, and Java brought in many
advances. We use the algorithmic representation in understanding the
problem and solution which is a lot more English-like along with
increased sophistication and functionality. We write modules that were
invoked as reusable components of programs. We write algorithms and
associated code which become reusable as well.

**So, why talk about this somewhat antiquated representation of life?**

With continuous progression and scientific growth, we can solve many
problems without needing to know what lies beneath the engine. I have
been writing 'Sunday Thoughts' for a while now and wished to create a
portal. Sandeep Upadhyay, my colleague and our PMO head in India,
offered to help during his weekend to get this out, however it continued
to stay in the backburner of my priorities up until now.

-   Most of the people I associate with now have the ability to use AI
    > and the large language models to ask questions, compose emails and
    > brainstorm thoughts. Remember that 40% of the world still does not
    > have access to the Internet or the SmartPhones

-   The next thing after LLMs that we have is a workbench to write code
    > using some of the available code accelerators or co-pilots. So I
    > decided to use the co-pilots and LLMs to publish all my writeups.
    > Firstly, I asked LLM to parse my long singular file of 2 years
    > worth of writing into individual pdfs by using the authored date
    > as a delimiter. Bingo - 1 minute later I had my individual pdfs.
    > Essentially, without any prior experience of programming I could
    > create a lot of code using these co-pilots. I used
    > [['Cursor']{.underline}](https://www.cursor.com/settings) and
    > OpenAI's co-pilot

-   Another co-pilot mode is also available in the algorithmic nature of
    > the language models. The 'Operator mode' is one such recent
    > development. It enables you to instruct the language model to
    > perform repetitive tasks

-   Operator mode makes ChatGPT not just a text generator but a gateway
    > to a suite of tools:

```{=html}
<!-- -->
```
-   It **receives and parses your request**. In my example, I told the
    > operator to pick each of my writeup files and give it a title.

-   It **decides which external tool** to call (e.g., DALLÂ·E for images,
    > Python for code execution). I asked OpenAI in operator mode to
    > create a prompt for the image and image subsequently to store the
    > image in the database. I asked it to create entries for
    > categories, content relevance (dated or not) and the creation date

-   It **sent the requests** to the operator mindset and **retrieved the
    > output**.

-   It **integrates** the external output into its final, cohesive
    > response. It organized my postgres database with all the intricate
    > details for each of the articles, individual pdf files and the ai
    > generated images that represent the article.

This seamless integration allows you to generate multimedia, code, and
dynamic information in one interactive conversation. So essentially my
process last week became a write-up for the thoughts this week.
[[Here]{.underline}](https://st-rust-rho.vercel.app/) is the
representation of the first cut and also access to the past write-ups.

Hope you all can leverage on this automated operator assistant similarly
or better.

**February 16, 2025**

**In 2 Decades:** Prior to plotting this chart, I could not have
recognized half of these plotted logos. If you put your birth year in
perspective you can think of how much of your life has overlapped ever
since 2004 that the ~~not so~~ smart devices gave you the pleasure of
solo-time in the fantasy islands created by these platforms. We have
moved away from 'sharing the feelings' to 'seeing/showing fantasies'.

![](media/image8.png){width="2.7777777777777776e-2in"
height="2.7777777777777776e-2in"}![](media/image3.png){width="6.5in"
height="3.7222222222222223in"}

Beyond the social fantasies is the world of assumptive entitlements.
Perks in the social or professional environments are often taken for
granted. Fitness centers in the housing or commercial complexes remain
greatly underutilized as you have paid for them indirectly. Free coffee
at the office (some of the luckier ones get a lot more) is taken for
granted. So, why all this?

**The 'Giver' Mindset:** One big thing besides the perks that remains
underutilized is in the contagion you can offer. Earlier, I had
mentioned about the fact that the first thing people notice when they
see you, are your hands, not your outfits or your shoes.

This greatly underutilized contagion of being and feeling good, which is
easily available to you remains largely unnoticed. Here is a quick
checklist to be able to share and communicate with others:

-   Assuming that others around you, especially the quiet ones, are okay
    > is dangerous

-   Your team, at home and at the workplace, need assurances more often
    > than you can imagine

-   Communicating often and giving occasional praises go a long way,
    > especially in intense workplaces

-   Communicating failures, bumps or challenges in timely manner matters
    > a lot

-   Timely expressiveness of joy and connection creates a safety net for
    > others

-   These investments build credibility for to you to later share tough
    > messages easily

-   If you are one of those who can't express with words then you can
    > bring in cookies to share

One more thing that I learnt lately is that we make a lot of reforms
with fitness, learning or wake up schedule. Most of us suck at keeping
up to them. Above all of these reforms, sits the determination to do
what you decide to do. If there is one thing that you can fix then this
is it: the sheer determination to keep up to your own commitments to
self. So what you are waiting for, go ahead and bake those cookies for
your buds.

title: Digital Identity Matters in Connected World
content:
#98

**\
Knowing your personal chatter (1)**: Do you talk to yourself? Answer is
a big yes, even if you responded with a 'no' right now while reading
this. We all do. When we do speak with self, we drift away from the
current moment of time and create chatter. Think about, as mentioned
last week, having a defined BHAG (Big Hairy Audacious Goal) and then
constantly drifting our mind away from objective(s).

Some examples of how it happens. You are driving and all of a sudden you
arrived at your destination without even remembering how you got there,
not remembering your list of groceries at the grocery store you had
decided to purchase when you left home or not remembering what you read
through the chapter of a book by the time you reach at the end of the
chapter. Chatter is normal and not all chatter is bad.

When in a social context, we use the reflection from chatter to impress
others from our conversations, which is quite natural. At the same time,
we can use this inner voice as an advantage to achieve our goals. We
also need to recognize that while we were formally taught to learn
maths, learn to paint, or even learn to swim, no one taught us to
concentrate as a skill. Teachers always told us to pay attention however
never to show 'how'?

**Technology Traps:** An easy example of how we easily get distracted is
in the infinite loop of social media reels. They work our mind in
orchestration with our implied expectations of distraction. You don't
even know what the next reel would be, however 'they' have figured out
what will make you stick. Our ability to pay attention or stay focused
on the task at hand is very low so we go in this endless loop. In
another example, imagine you are sitting on your couch and you get
called to help by your spouse or your parent. Your ability to respond to
them is much lower than a passive beep from your phone's messages.
Technology can be good as long as we are incharge of it.

Everything written on this page so far is about 'knowing' what causes
distractions. Now a little bit on 'Focusing' or 'Being'.

**Focusing or Being (2):** Being 'meditative objectively' is an
oxymoronic thought. To meditate with a purpose will not happen. Although
married to one, I am nowhere close to being a practitioner, let alone
writing about it.

Imagine you are watching a movie, the director has written the script to
navigate in your mind to make you feel angry, joyful, hungry, sad or
even lusty, all within a span of a short window. In one of the learning
videos, I saw that in order to increase focus and not experience all
these emotions in our chatter, we need to focus. Focus momentarily
closing your eyes on the chair you might be sitting on, close your eyes
to bring awareness to the room you are sitting in, remember the event
like a wedding or a birthday party you may have attended recently or
your recent holidays. One of the things we started following recently in
my family is to remember in the morning all the things we ate or drank
in the previous 24 hours, everything. This is hard and you will tend to
forget many things you ate including a small candy. If practiced well,
it will allow you to identify moments to focus, bring awareness of what
you ate and take you back to your guilty pleasures from the day before.

**Expecting Rightly (3)**: I personally realize that knowing and then
ignoring distractions is easier, being objectively meditative is a lot
harder and as a result it will be much easier for me to manage
expectations. Here are some for me:

-   Be cognitively aware of distractions, dissolve chatter and focus as
    > much as possible

-   Avoid getting supplements or being drugged in order to induce sleep
    > or bringing peace to mind

-   Sleep, Exercise and eat healthy (hard, hard, hard)

-   Distance yourself from remunerations or sitting in the expectations
    > of glory

-   Build long term goals and not expect short term returns

So ask yourself a question in this very materialistic and dystopian
world, where you do want to always to be:

-   Knowing your distractions in real-time (1),

-   Being meditative (2) or

-   Setting manageable expectations (3)

Truth is always somewhere in between.

A write-up of a modern day Fantasy Land.

**Then and Now**

When I first saw a Tesla car at a showroom in San Jose around 2011, I
could see that there was no engine in the car and the front of the
vehicle had empty space which was referred to as 'Frunk - as a Frontside
Trunk'. It was my 'what the frunk?' moment. Electric Vehicles actually
were invented a bit prior to the combustion engine vehicles however
rechargeable batteries were not invented then. After a very long history
of more than 125 years of commercial use of combustion engine vehicles,
hybrid technology was employed in Battery/Gasoline versions of cars like
Nissan Leaf, Toyota Prius and Chevy Volt. It was followed by a massive
revolution in Electric Vehicles through large scale production of EVs by
Tesla. [Many followed this trait.]{.mark} Today, we are at the cusp of
FSD (Full Self Driving) in its nascent phase.

Another pot where life is melting similar to automobiles, is software
engineering. Coding co-pilots are enhancing (or disrupting) the lives of
software engineers. Your mastery from expertise and experience of
programming languages is getting replaced by co-pilots, which accelerate
your throughputs by giving 3x productivity on average. You summon the
co-pilot with the best of the commands (pun intended) and it responds
exceedingly well.

With another perspective, Modern telescopes like the James Webb Space
Telescope (JWST) can observe light emitted billions of years ago due to
a combination of advanced engineering, infrared technology, and the
fundamental nature of light itself. This part has fascinated me for
years. We can see the past because of the 'time machine' effect captured

including bacteria, viruses, and fungi. Functions of diet, lifestyle and

enable immunity, vitamin creation, immune system modulation and
maintaining the barrier to keep the gut health intact. Damaged gut can
impact heart health, liver health, and mental health resulting in
diseases/dysfunctionality like cholesterol, diabetes, fatty liver,
deteriorated circadian rhythm and more. Supplements like Super gut and
procedures like Fecal Microbial Transplant (replacing your Gut

underlying gut surface area which actually is a cause for many of the
named diseases.

In another example, introduction of 'Neuralink' in experimental stages
will help to manage significant dysfunctions in the human back problems
and even the vision. This is giving a huge hope in fixing a lot of
physical impairments by leveraging healthcare and technology
improvements together.

transportation and more.
